64// Global array that stores the feature input configuration of BMI270
65const struct bmi2_feature_config bmi270_feat_in[DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_MAX_FEAT_IN] = { { BMI2_CONFIG_ID , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_CONFIG_ID_STRT_ADDR },
66 { BMI2_MAX_BURST_LEN , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_MAX_BURST_LEN_STRT_ADDR },
67 { BMI2_CRT_GYRO_SELF_TEST , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_CRT_GYRO_SELF_TEST_STRT_ADDR },
68 { BMI2_ABORT_CRT_GYRO_SELF_TEST , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_ABORT_STRT_ADDR },
69 { BMI2_AXIS_MAP , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_AXIS_MAP_STRT_ADDR },
70 { BMI2_GYRO_SELF_OFF , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_GYRO_SELF_OFF_STRT_ADDR },
71 { BMI2_NVM_PROG_PREP , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_NVM_PROG_PREP_STRT_ADDR },
72 { BMI2_GYRO_GAIN_UPDATE , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_GYRO_GAIN_UPDATE_STRT_ADDR },
73 { BMI2_ANY_MOTION , BMI2_PAGE_1 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_ANY_MOT_STRT_ADDR },
74 { BMI2_NO_MOTION , BMI2_PAGE_2 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_NO_MOT_STRT_ADDR },
75 { BMI2_SIG_MOTION , BMI2_PAGE_2 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_SIG_MOT_STRT_ADDR },
76 { BMI2_STEP_COUNTER_PARAMS , BMI2_PAGE_3 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_STEP_CNT_1_STRT_ADDR },
77 { BMI2_STEP_DETECTOR , BMI2_PAGE_6 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_STEP_CNT_4_STRT_ADDR },
78 { BMI2_STEP_COUNTER , BMI2_PAGE_6 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_STEP_CNT_4_STRT_ADDR },
79 { BMI2_STEP_ACTIVITY , BMI2_PAGE_6 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_STEP_CNT_4_STRT_ADDR },

81 { BMI2_WRIST_WEAR_WAKE_UP , BMI2_PAGE_7 , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_WRIST_WEAR_WAKE_UP_STRT_ADDR },
82 };

94// Global array that stores the feature interrupts of BMI270
95struct bmi2_map_int bmi270_map_int[DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_MAX_INT_MAP] = { { BMI2_SIG_MOTION , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_SIG_MOT_MASK },
96 { BMI2_STEP_COUNTER , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_STEP_COUNTER_MASK },
97 { BMI2_STEP_DETECTOR , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_STEP_DETECTOR_MASK },
98 { BMI2_STEP_ACTIVITY , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_STEP_ACT_MASK },
99 { BMI2_WRIST_GESTURE , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_WRIST_GEST_MASK },
100 { BMI2_WRIST_WEAR_WAKE_UP , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_WRIST_WEAR_WAKEUP_MASK },
101 { BMI2_ANY_MOTION , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_ANY_MOT_MASK },
102 { BMI2_NO_MOTION , DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_INT_NO_MOT_MASK },
103 };

106// Select features and their pins to be mapped to.
107struct bmi2_sens_int_config sens_int[4] = { { BMI2_ANY_MOTION , BMI2_INT1 },
108 { BMI2_NO_MOTION , BMI2_INT1 },
109 { BMI2_STEP_DETECTOR , BMI2_INT1 },
110 { BMI2_SIG_MOTION , BMI2_INT1 },
111 };

548 };

554#pragma region CLASS_MEMBERS

556
564DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270() : DIODEVICEI2C()
565{
566 Clean();
567}
568
569
578DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::~DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270()
579{
580 End();
581
582 Clean();
583}
584
585
595XDWORD DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetGPIOInterruptEntryID()
596{
597 return GPIOinterruptentryID;
598}
599
600
612bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::SetGPIOInterruptEntryID(XDWORD GPIOentryID)
613{
614 GPIOinterruptentryID = GPIOentryID;
615
616 return true;
617}
618
619
629bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::IsNecessaryUpdate()
630{
631 return isnecessaryupdate;
632}
633
634
644void DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::SetIsNecessaryUpdate(bool isnecessaryupdate)
645{
646 this->isnecessaryupdate = isnecessaryupdate;
647}
648
649
659XBYTE DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::Update()
660{
661 XBYTE ret_value = 0xFF;
662
663 if(!IsNecessaryUpdate()) return ret_value;
664
665 XWORD int_status = 0; // Variable to get interrupt status.
666 XBYTE rslt; // Status of api are returned to this variable.
667
668 // Loop to get interrupt.
669 // Clear buffer.
670 int_status = 0;
671
672 // To get the interrupt status
673 rslt = bmi2_get_int_status(&int_status, &bmi2_dev);
674 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
675
676 if(prev_status != -1 && int_status == prev_status || (int_status&0xFF) == 0)
677 {
678 return ret_value;
679 }
680
681 // To check the interrupt status of any-motion.
682 if(int_status & DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_ANY_MOT_STATUS_MASK)
683 {
684 XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("[ACCEL] Any-motion interrupt is generated"));
685 any_motion = 1;
686 }
687 else
688 {
689 any_motion = 0;
690 }
691
692 // To check the interrupt status of no-motion.
693 if(int_status & DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_NO_MOT_STATUS_MASK)
694 {
695 XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("[ACCEL] No-motion interrupt is generated"));
696 no_motion = 1;
697 }
698 else
699 {
700 no_motion = 0;
701 }
702
703 // To check the interrupt status of no-motion.
704 if(int_status & DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_SIG_MOT_STATUS_MASK)
705 {
706 XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("[ACCEL] Significant motion interrupt is generated"));
707 sig_motion = 1;
708 }
709 else
710 {
711 sig_motion = 0;
712 }
713
714 if(int_status & DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_STEP_CNT_STATUS_MASK)
715 {
716 XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("[ACCEL] Counter interrupt is generated"));
717 step_event = 1;
718 }
719 else
720 {
721 step_event = 0;
722 }
723
724 if(int_status & DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270_STEP_ACT_STATUS_MASK)
725 {
726 XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("[ACCEL] Activity interrupt is generated"));
727 }
728
729 prev_status = (XDWORDSIG)int_status;
730
731 SetIsNecessaryUpdate(false);
732
733 return ret_value;
734}
735
736
746bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetSetAnyMove()
747{
748 XBYTE any_motion_ = any_motion;
749
750 if(any_motion)
751 {
752 any_motion = 0;
753 }
754
755 return any_motion_;
756}
757
758
768bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetSignificantMotion()
769{
770 XBYTE sig_motion_ = sig_motion;
771
772 if(sig_motion)
773 {
774 sig_motion = 0;
775 any_motion = 0;
776 }
777
778 return sig_motion_;
779}
780
781
782
792bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetStep_AddOne()
793{
794 XBYTE step_event_ = step_event;
795
796 if(step_event)
797 {
798 step_event = 0;
799 any_motion = 0;
800 }
801
802 return step_event_;
803}
804
805
815bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetTap_AddOne()
816{
817
818 XBYTE tap_event_ = tap_event;
819
820 if(tap_event)
821 {
822 any_motion = 0;
823 tap_event = 0;
824 }
825
826 return tap_event_;
827}
828
829
839bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetHighGMotion()
840{
841 XBYTE highGmotion_ = highGmotion;
842
843 if(highGmotion)
844 {
845 any_motion = 0;
846 highGmotion = 0;
847 }
848
849 return highGmotion_;
850}
851
852
862bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetLowGMotion()
863{
864 XBYTE lowGmotion_ = lowGmotion;
865
866 if(lowGmotion)
867 {
868 any_motion = 0;
869 lowGmotion = 0;
870 }
871
872 return lowGmotion_;
873}
874
875
885bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::GetNotMove()
886{
887 // XBYTE no_motion_ = no_motion;
888 //
889 // if(no_motion)
890 // no_motion = 0;
891 //
892 // return no_motion_;
893
894 return 0;
895}
896
897
907bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::End()
908{
909 if(!DIODEVICE::End()) return false;
910
911 return true;
912}
913
914
924bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::IniDevice()
925{
926 if(!DIODEVICEI2C::IniDevice()) return false;
927
928 if(diostream->Open())
929 {
930 if(diostream->WaitToConnected(timeout))
931 {
932 if(!Inicializate()) return false;
933
934 return DIODEVICE::Ini();;
935 }
936 }
937
938 return false;
939}
940
941
951bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::Inicializate()
952{
953 // Status of api are returned to this variable.
954 XBYTE rslt;
955
956 // Accel sensor and any-motion feature are listed in array.
957 sens_list[0] = BMI2_ACCEL;
958 sens_list[1] = BMI2_NO_MOTION;
959 sens_list[2] = BMI2_SIG_MOTION;
960 sens_list[3] = BMI2_ANY_MOTION;
961 sens_list[4] = BMI2_STEP_DETECTOR;
962
963
964 // Variable to get any-motion interrupt status.
965 //XWORD int_status = 0;
966
967 // Interface reference is given as a parameter
968 // For I2C : BMI2_I2C_INTF
969 // For SPI : BMI2_SPI_INTF
970
971 rslt = bmi2_interface_init(&bmi2_dev, BMI2_I2C_INTF);
972 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
973
974 // Initialize bmi270.
975 rslt = bmi270_init(&bmi2_dev);
976 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
977
978 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
979 {
980 // Enable the selected sensors.
981 rslt = bmi270_sensor_enable(sens_list, 5, &bmi2_dev);
982 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
983
984 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
985 {
986 // Set feature configurations
987 rslt = SetFeatureConfig(&bmi2_dev);
988 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
989
990 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
991 {
992 // Map the feature interrupt.
993 rslt = bmi270_map_feat_int(sens_int, 4, &bmi2_dev);
994 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
995
996 XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("[ACCEL: Move the board]"));
997 }
998 }
999 }
1000
1001 sig_motion = 0;
1002 highGmotion = 0;
1003 lowGmotion = 0;
1004 step_event = 0;
1005 tap_event = 0;
1006 any_motion = 0;
1007 no_motion = 0;
1008
1009 //Enable interrupt pin
1010
1011 return rslt;
1012}
1013
1014
1028bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::ReadRegister(XBYTE offset, XBYTE* data, XDWORD sizedata)
1029{
1030 if(!diostream) return false;
1031
1032 bool status;
1033
1034 status = diostream->Write(&offset, 1)?true:false;
1035 if(status)
1036 {
1037 status = diostream->WaitToFlushOutXBuffer(timeout);
1038 }
1039
1040 if(!status)
1041 {
1042 return false;
1043 }
1044
1045 status = diostream->WaitToFilledReadingBuffer(sizedata, timeout);
1046 if(status)
1047 {
1048 status = (diostream->Read(data, sizedata) == sizedata)?true:false;
1049 }
1050
1051 return status;
1052}
1053
1054
1068bool DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::WriteRegister(XBYTE offset, XBYTE* data, XDWORD sizedata)
1069{
1070 if(!diostream) return false;
1071
1072 XBUFFER buffer;
1073 bool status;
1074
1075 buffer.Add((XBYTE)offset);
1076 if(data && sizedata) buffer.Add(data, sizedata);
1077
1078 status = diostream->Write(buffer)?true:false;
1079 if(status) status = diostream->WaitToFlushOutXBuffer(timeout);
1080
1081 return status;
1082}
1083
1084
1099BMI2_INTF_RETURN_TYPE DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_i2c_read(XBYTE reg_addr, XBYTE* reg_data, XDWORD len, void* intf_ptr)
1100{
1101 return ReadRegister(reg_addr, reg_data, len);
1102}
1103
1104
1119BMI2_INTF_RETURN_TYPE DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_i2c_write(XBYTE reg_addr, const XBYTE* reg_data, XDWORD len, void* intf_ptr)
1120{
1121 return WriteRegister(reg_addr, (XBYTE*)reg_data, len);
1122}
1123
1124
1138XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::SetFeatureConfig(struct bmi2_dev *bmi2_dev)
1139{
1140
1141 /* Status of api are returned to this variable. */
1142 XBYTESIG rslt;
1143
1144 /* Structure to define the type of sensor and its configurations. */
1145 struct bmi2_sens_config config;
1146
1147
1148 /**********************************************************************/
1149// /* Configure the type of feature. */
1150// config.type = BMI2_ACCEL;
1151//
1152// /* Get default configurations for the type of feature selected. */
1153// rslt = bmi270_get_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1154// bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1155//
1156// if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1157// {
1158// /* NOTE: The user can change the following configuration parameters according to their requirement. */
1159// /* Set Output Data Rate */
1160// config.cfg.acc.odr = BMI2_ACC_ODR_200HZ;
1161//
1162// /* Gravity range of the sensor (+/- 2G, 4G, 8G, 16G). */
1163// config.cfg.acc.range = BMI2_ACC_RANGE_2G;
1164//
1165// /* The bandwidth parameter is used to configure the number of sensor samples that are averaged
1166// * if it is set to 2, then 2^(bandwidth parameter) samples
1167// * are averaged, resulting in 4 averaged samples.
1168// * Note1 : For more information, refer the datasheet.
1169// * Note2 : A higher number of averaged samples will result in a lower noise level of the signal, but
1170// * this has an adverse effect on the power consumed.
1171// */
1172// config.cfg.acc.bwp = BMI2_ACC_NORMAL_AVG4;
1173//
1174// /* Enable the filter performance mode where averaging of samples
1175// * will be done based on above set bandwidth and ODR.
1176// * There are two modes
1177// * 0 -> Ultra low power mode
1178// * 1 -> High performance mode(Default)
1179// * For more info refer datasheet.
1180// */
1181// config.cfg.acc.filter_perf = BMI2_PERF_OPT_MODE;
1182//
1183// /* Set the accel configurations. */
1184// rslt = bmi270_set_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1185// bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1186// }
1187//
1188
1189 /**********************************************************************/
1190 /* Configure the type of feature. */
1191 config.type = BMI2_ANY_MOTION;
1192
1193 /* Get default configurations for the type of feature selected. */
1194 rslt = bmi270_get_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1195 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1196 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1197 {
1198 /* NOTE: The user can change the following configuration parameters according to their requirement. */
1199 /* 1LSB equals 20ms. Default is 100ms, setting to 80ms. */
1200 config.cfg.any_motion.duration = 0x0A;//0x04;
1201
1202 /* 1LSB equals to 0.48mg. Default is 83mg, setting to 50mg. */
1203 config.cfg.any_motion.threshold = 0x9C;//0x68;
1204
1205 /* Set new configurations. */
1206 rslt = bmi270_set_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1207 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1208 }
1209 /**********************************************************************/
1210 /* Configure the type of feature. */
1211 config.type = BMI2_NO_MOTION;
1212
1213 /* Get default configurations for the type of feature selected. */
1214 rslt = bmi270_get_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1215 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1216 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1217 {
1218 /* NOTE: The user can change the following configuration parameters according to their requirement. */
1219 /* 1LSB equals 20ms. Default is 100ms, setting to 80ms. */
1220 config.cfg.no_motion.duration = 0x04;
1221
1222 /* 1LSB equals to 0.48mg. Default is 83mg, setting to 50mg. */
1223 config.cfg.no_motion.threshold = 0x68;
1224
1225 /* Set new configurations. */
1226 rslt = bmi270_set_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1227 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1228 }
1229 /**********************************************************************/
1230 /* Configure the type of feature. */
1231 config.type = BMI2_STEP_DETECTOR;
1232
1233 /* Get default configurations for the type of feature selected. */
1234 rslt = bmi270_get_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1235 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1236 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1237 {
1238 //config.cfg.step_counter_params
1239
1240 /* Set new configurations. */
1241 //rslt = bmi270_set_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1242 //bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1243 }
1244
1245 /**********************************************************************/
1246 /* Configure the type of feature. */
1247 config.type = BMI2_SIG_MOTION;
1248
1249 /* Get default configurations for the type of feature selected. */
1250 rslt = bmi270_get_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1251 bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1252 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1253 {
1254
1255 }
1256
1257 /**********************************************************************/
1258 /* Configure the type of feature. */
1259 // config.type = BMI2_LOW_G;
1260 //
1261 // /* Get default configurations for the type of feature selected. */
1262 // rslt = bmi270_get_sensor_config(&config, 1, bmi2_dev);
1263 // bmi2_error_codes_print_result(rslt);
1264 // if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1265 // {
1269 //
1270 // }
1271
1272 return rslt;
1273}
1274
1275
1286void DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_delay_us(XDWORD period, void *intf_ptr)
1287{
1288 //coines_delay_usec(period);
1289 if(period >= 1000)
1290 GEN_XSLEEP.MilliSeconds(period/1000);
1291 else
1292 GEN_XSLEEP.MilliSeconds(1);
1293
1294}
1295
1296
1309XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_interface_init(struct bmi2_dev *bmi, XBYTE intf)
1310{
1311 XBYTESIG rslt = BMI2_OK;
1312 //struct coines_board_info board_info;
1313
1314 if(bmi != NULL)
1315 {
1316 GEN_XSLEEP.MilliSeconds(200);
1317
1318 /* Bus configuration : I2C */
1319 if(intf == BMI2_I2C_INTF)
1320 {
1321 /* To initialize the user I2C function */
1322 dev_addr = BMI2_I2C_SEC_ADDR;
1323 bmi->intf = BMI2_I2C_INTF;
1324
1325 //bmi->read = (bmi2_read_fptr_t)bmi2_i2c_read;
1326 //bmi->write = (bmi2_write_fptr_t)bmi2_i2c_write;
1327 }
1328
1329 /* Assign device address to interface pointer */
1330 bmi->intf_ptr = &dev_addr;
1331
1332 /* Configure delay in microseconds */
1333 //bmi->delay_us = (bmi2_delay_fptr_t)bmi2_delay_us;
1334
1335 /* Configure max read/write length (in bytes) ( Supported length depends on target machine) */
1336 bmi->read_write_len = READ_WRITE_LEN;
1337
1338 /* Assign to NULL to load the default config file. */
1339 bmi->config_file_ptr = NULL;
1340
1341 GEN_XSLEEP.MilliSeconds(10);
1342 }
1343 else
1344 {
1345 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1346 }
1347
1348 return rslt;
1349}
1350
1351
1361void DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_error_codes_print_result(XBYTESIG rslt)
1362{
1363
1364 switch (rslt)
1365 {
1366 case BMI2_OK : break;
1367 case BMI2_W_FIFO_EMPTY : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("[Warning [%d] : FIFO empty]"),rslt); break;
1368 case BMI2_W_PARTIAL_READ : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Warning [%d] : FIFO partial read"),rslt); break;
1369 case BMI2_E_NULL_PTR : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Null pointer error. It occurs when the user tries to assign value (not address) to a pointer, which has been initialized to NULL."),rslt); break;
1370 case BMI2_E_COM_FAIL : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Communication failure error. It occurs due to read/write operation failure and also due " "to power failure during communication"),rslt); break;
1371 case BMI2_E_DEV_NOT_FOUND : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Device not found error. It occurs when the device chip id is incorrectly read"),rslt); break;
1372 case BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid sensor error. It occurs when there is a mismatch in the requested feature with the " "available one "),rslt); break;
1373 case BMI2_E_SELF_TEST_FAIL : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Self-test failed error. It occurs when the validation of accel self-test data is " "not satisfied "),rslt); break;
1374 case BMI2_E_INVALID_INT_PIN : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid interrupt pin error. It occurs when the user tries to configure interrupt pins " "apart from INT1 and INT2 "),rslt); break;
1375 case BMI2_E_OUT_OF_RANGE : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Out of range error. It occurs when the data exceeds from filtered or unfiltered data from " "fifo and also when the range exceeds the maximum range for accel and gyro while performing FOC "),rslt); break;
1376 case BMI2_E_ACC_INVALID_CFG : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid Accel configuration error. It occurs when there is an error in accel configuration" " register which could be one among range, BW or filter performance in reg address 0x40"),rslt); break;
1377 case BMI2_E_GYRO_INVALID_CFG : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid Gyro configuration error. It occurs when there is a error in gyro configuration" "register which could be one among range, BW or filter performance in reg address 0x42 "),rslt); break;
1378 case BMI2_E_ACC_GYR_INVALID_CFG : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid Accel-Gyro configuration error. It occurs when there is a error in accel and gyro" " configuration registers which could be one among range, BW or filter performance in reg address 0x40 " "and 0x42"),rslt); break;
1379 case BMI2_E_CONFIG_LOAD : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Configuration load error. It occurs when failure observed while loading the configuration " "into the sensor "),rslt); break;
1380 case BMI2_E_INVALID_PAGE : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid page error. It occurs due to failure in writing the correct feature configuration " "from selected page "),rslt); break;
1381 case BMI2_E_SET_APS_FAIL : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : APS failure error. It occurs due to failure in write of advance power mode configuration " "register "),rslt); break;
1382 case BMI2_E_AUX_INVALID_CFG : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid AUX configuration error. It occurs when the auxiliary interface settings are not " "enabled properly "),rslt); break;
1383 case BMI2_E_AUX_BUSY : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : AUX busy error. It occurs when the auxiliary interface buses are engaged while configuring" " the AUX "),rslt); break;
1384 case BMI2_E_REMAP_ERROR : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Remap error. It occurs due to failure in assigning the remap axes data for all the axes " "after change in axis position "),rslt); break;
1385 case BMI2_E_GYR_USER_GAIN_UPD_FAIL : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Gyro user gain update fail error. It occurs when the reading of user gain update status " "fails "),rslt); break;
1386 case BMI2_E_SELF_TEST_NOT_DONE : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Self-test not done error. It occurs when the self-test process is ongoing or not " "completed "),rslt); break;
1387 case BMI2_E_INVALID_INPUT : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid input error. It occurs when the sensor input validity fails "),rslt); break;
1388 case BMI2_E_INVALID_STATUS : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid status error. It occurs when the feature/sensor validity fails "),rslt); break;
1389 case BMI2_E_CRT_ERROR : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : CRT error. It occurs when the CRT test has failed "),rslt); break;
1390 case BMI2_E_ST_ALREADY_RUNNING : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Self-test already running error. It occurs when the self-test is already running and " "another has been initiated "),rslt); break;
1391 case BMI2_E_CRT_READY_FOR_DL_FAIL_ABORT : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : CRT ready for download fail abort error. It occurs when download in CRT fails due to wrong " "address location "),rslt); break;
1392 case BMI2_E_DL_ERROR : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Download error. It occurs when write length exceeds that of the maximum burst length "),rslt); break;
1393 case BMI2_E_PRECON_ERROR : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Pre-conditional error. It occurs when precondition to start the feature was not " "completed "), rslt); break;
1394 case BMI2_E_ABORT_ERROR : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Abort error. It occurs when the device was shaken during CRT test "),rslt); break;
1395 case BMI2_E_WRITE_CYCLE_ONGOING : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Write cycle ongoing error. It occurs when the write cycle is already running and another " "has been initiated "),rslt); break;
1396 case BMI2_E_ST_NOT_RUNING : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Self-test is not running error. It occurs when self-test running is disabled while it's " "running "),rslt); break;
1397 case BMI2_E_DATA_RDY_INT_FAILED : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Data ready interrupt error. It occurs when the sample count exceeds the FOC sample limit " "and data ready status is not updated "),rslt); break;
1398 case BMI2_E_INVALID_FOC_POSITION : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Invalid FOC position error. It occurs when average FOC data is obtained for the wrong" " axes "),rslt); break;
1399 default : XTRACE_PRINTCOLOR(XTRACE_COLOR_BLUE, __L("Error [%d] : Unknown error code "),rslt); break;
1400 }
1401}
1402
1403
1415XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_sec_init(struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1416{
1417 /* Variable to define error */
1418 XBYTESIG rslt;
1419
1420 /* Variable to assign chip id */
1421 XBYTE chip_id = 0;
1422
1423 /* Structure to define the default values for axes re-mapping */
1424 struct bmi2_axes_remap axes_remap = { BMI2_MAP_X_AXIS, BMI2_MAP_Y_AXIS,BMI2_MAP_Z_AXIS, BMI2_POS_SIGN, BMI2_POS_SIGN, BMI2_POS_SIGN };
1425
1426 /* Null-pointer check */
1427 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1428 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1429 {
1430 /* Perform soft-reset to bring all register values to their
1431 * default values
1432 */
1433 rslt = bmi2_soft_reset(dev);
1434
1435 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1436 {
1437 /* Read chip-id of the BMI2 sensor */
1438 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_CHIP_ID_ADDR, &chip_id, 1, dev);
1439
1440 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1441 {
1442 /* Validate chip-id */
1443 if(chip_id == dev->chip_id)
1444 {
1445 /* Assign resolution to the structure */
1446 dev->resolution = 16;
1447
1448 /* Set manual enable flag */
1449 dev->aux_man_en = 1;
1450
1451 /* Set the default values for axis
1452 * re-mapping in the device structure
1453 */
1454 dev->remap = axes_remap;
1455 }
1456 else
1457 {
1458 /* Storing the chip-id value read from
1459 * the register to identify the sensor
1460 */
1461 dev->chip_id = chip_id;
1462 rslt = BMI2_E_DEV_NOT_FOUND;
1463 }
1464 }
1465 }
1466 }
1467
1468 return rslt;
1469}
1470
1471
1488XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_regs(XBYTE reg_addr, XBYTE *data, XWORD len, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1489{
1490 // Variable to define error
1491 XBYTESIG rslt;
1492
1493 // Variable to define loop
1494 XWORD index = 0;
1495
1496 XBYTE temp_buf[200];
1497
1498 // Null-pointer check
1499 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1500 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (data != NULL))
1501 {
1502 // Variable to define temporary length
1503 XWORD temp_len = len + dev->dummy_byte;
1504
1505 if(temp_len > 200)
1506 return BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1507
1508 // Configuring reg_addr for SPI Interface
1509 if(dev->intf == BMI2_SPI_INTF)
1510 {
1511 reg_addr = (reg_addr | BMI2_SPI_RD_MASK);
1512 }
1513
1514 dev->intf_rslt = bmi2_i2c_read(reg_addr, temp_buf, temp_len, dev->intf_ptr);
1515
1516 if(dev->aps_status == BMI2_ENABLE)
1517 {
1518 //dev->delay_us(450, dev->intf_ptr);
1519 bmi2_delay_us(450, dev->intf_ptr);
1520 }
1521 else
1522 {
1523 //dev->delay_us(2, dev->intf_ptr);
1524 bmi2_delay_us(2, dev->intf_ptr);
1525 }
1526
1527 if(dev->intf_rslt == BMI2_INTF_RET_SUCCESS)
1528 {
1529 /* Read the data from the position next to dummy byte */
1530 while (index < len)
1531 {
1532 data[index] = temp_buf[index + dev->dummy_byte];
1533 index++;
1534 }
1535 }
1536 else
1537 {
1538 rslt = BMI2_E_COM_FAIL;
1539 }
1540 }
1541 else
1542 {
1543 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1544 }
1545
1546 return rslt;
1547}
1548
1549
1564XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_regs(XBYTE reg_addr, const XBYTE *data, XWORD len, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1565{
1566 /* Variable to define error */
1567 XBYTESIG rslt;
1568
1569 /* Null-pointer check */
1570 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1571 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (data != NULL))
1572 {
1573 /* Configuring reg_addr for SPI Interface */
1574 if(dev->intf == BMI2_SPI_INTF)
1575 {
1576 reg_addr = (reg_addr & BMI2_SPI_WR_MASK);
1577 }
1578
1579 //dev->intf_rslt = dev->write(reg_addr, data, len, dev->intf_ptr);
1580 dev->intf_rslt = bmi2_i2c_write(reg_addr, data, len, dev->intf_ptr);
1581
1582 /* Delay for Low power mode of the sensor is 450 us */
1583 if(dev->aps_status == BMI2_ENABLE)
1584 {
1585 //dev->delay_us(450, dev->intf_ptr);
1586 bmi2_delay_us(450, dev->intf_ptr);
1587 }
1588 /* Delay for Normal mode of the sensor is 2 us */
1589 else
1590 {
1591 //dev->delay_us(2, dev->intf_ptr);
1592 bmi2_delay_us(2, dev->intf_ptr);
1593 }
1594
1595 /* updating the advance power saver flag */
1596 if(reg_addr == BMI2_PWR_CONF_ADDR)
1597 {
1598 if(*data & BMI2_ADV_POW_EN_MASK)
1599 {
1600 dev->aps_status = BMI2_ENABLE;
1601 }
1602 else
1603 {
1604 dev->aps_status = BMI2_DISABLE;
1605 }
1606 }
1607
1608 if(dev->intf_rslt != BMI2_INTF_RET_SUCCESS)
1609 {
1610 rslt = BMI2_E_COM_FAIL;
1611 }
1612 }
1613 else
1614 {
1615 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1616 }
1617
1618 return rslt;
1619}
1620
1621
1633XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_soft_reset(struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1634{
1635 /* Variable to define error */
1636 XBYTESIG rslt;
1637
1638 /* Variable to define soft reset value */
1639 XBYTE data = BMI2_SOFT_RESET_CMD;
1640
1641 /* Variable to read the dummy byte */
1642 XBYTE dummy_read = 0;
1643
1644 /* Null-pointer check */
1645 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1646 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1647 {
1648 /* Reset bmi2 device */
1649 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_CMD_REG_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
1650 //dev->delay_us(2000, dev->intf_ptr);
1651 bmi2_delay_us(2000, dev->intf_ptr);
1652
1653 /* set APS flag as after soft reset the sensor is on advance power save mode */
1654 dev->aps_status = BMI2_ENABLE;
1655
1656 /* Performing a dummy read to bring interface back to SPI from
1657 * I2C after a soft-reset
1658 */
1659 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (dev->intf == BMI2_SPI_INTF))
1660 {
1661 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_CHIP_ID_ADDR, &dummy_read, 1, dev);
1662 }
1663
1664 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1665 {
1666 /* Write the configuration file */
1667 rslt = bmi2_write_config_file(dev);
1668 }
1669
1670 /* Reset the sensor status flag in the device structure */
1671 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1672 {
1673 dev->sens_en_stat = 0;
1674 }
1675 }
1676
1677 return rslt;
1678}
1679
1680
1694XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_config_file_version(XBYTE *config_major, XBYTE *config_minor, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1695{
1696 /* Variable to define error */
1697 XBYTESIG rslt;
1698
1699 /* NULL pointer check */
1700 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1701 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (config_major != NULL) && (config_minor != NULL))
1702 {
1703 /* Extract the config file identification from the dmr page and get the major and minor version */
1704 rslt = extract_config_file(config_major, config_minor, dev);
1705 }
1706 else
1707 {
1708 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1709 }
1710
1711 return rslt;
1712}
1713
1714
1727XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_adv_power_save(XBYTE enable, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1728{
1729 /* Variable to define error */
1730 XBYTESIG rslt;
1731
1732 /* Variable to store data */
1733 XBYTE reg_data = 0;
1734
1735 /* Null-pointer check */
1736 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1737 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1738 {
1739 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_PWR_CONF_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
1740 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1741 {
1742 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(reg_data, BMI2_ADV_POW_EN, enable);
1743 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_PWR_CONF_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
1744
1745 if(rslt != BMI2_OK)
1746 {
1747 /* Return error if enable/disable APS fails */
1748 rslt = BMI2_E_SET_APS_FAIL;
1749 }
1750
1751 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1752 {
1753 dev->aps_status = BMI2_GET_BIT_POS0(reg_data, BMI2_ADV_POW_EN);
1754 }
1755 }
1756 }
1757
1758 return rslt;
1759}
1760
1761
1774XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_adv_power_save(XBYTE *aps_status, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1775{
1776 /* Variable to define error */
1777 XBYTESIG rslt;
1778
1779 /* Variable to store data */
1780 XBYTE reg_data = 0;
1781
1782 /* Null-pointer check */
1783 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1784 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aps_status != NULL))
1785 {
1786 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_PWR_CONF_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
1787 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1788 {
1789 *aps_status = BMI2_GET_BIT_POS0(reg_data, BMI2_ADV_POW_EN);
1790 dev->aps_status = *aps_status;
1791 }
1792 }
1793 else
1794 {
1795 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1796 }
1797
1798 return rslt;
1799}
1800
1801
1813XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_write_config_file(struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1814{
1815 /* Variable to define error */
1816 XBYTESIG rslt;
1817
1818 /* Variable to know the load status */
1819 XBYTE load_status = 0;
1820
1821 /* Null-pointer check */
1822 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1823 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (dev->config_size != 0))
1824 {
1825 /* Bytes written are multiples of 2 */
1826 if((dev->read_write_len % 2) != 0)
1827 {
1828 dev->read_write_len = dev->read_write_len - 1;
1829 }
1830
1831 if(dev->read_write_len < 2)
1832 {
1833 dev->read_write_len = 2;
1834 }
1835
1836 /* Write the configuration file */
1837 rslt = write_config_file(dev);
1838 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1839 {
1840 /* Check the configuration load status */
1841 rslt = bmi2_get_internal_status(&load_status, dev);
1842
1843 /* Return error if loading not successful */
1844 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (!(load_status & BMI2_CONFIG_LOAD_SUCCESS)))
1845 {
1846 rslt = BMI2_E_CONFIG_LOAD;
1847 }
1848 }
1849 }
1850 else
1851 {
1852 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1853 }
1854
1855 return rslt;
1856}
1857
1858
1872XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_int_pin_config(const struct bmi2_int_pin_config *int_cfg, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1873{
1874 /* Variable to define error */
1875 XBYTESIG rslt;
1876
1877 /* Variable to define data array */
1878 XBYTE data_array[3] = { 0 };
1879
1880 /* Variable to store register data */
1881 XBYTE reg_data = 0;
1882
1883 /* Variable to define type of interrupt pin */
1884 XBYTE int_pin = 0;
1885
1886 /* Null-pointer check */
1887 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1888 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (int_cfg != NULL))
1889 {
1890 /* Copy the pin type to a local variable */
1891 int_pin = int_cfg->pin_type;
1892 if((int_pin > BMI2_INT_NONE) && (int_pin < BMI2_INT_PIN_MAX))
1893 {
1894 /* Get the previous configuration data */
1895 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_INT1_IO_CTRL_ADDR, data_array, 3, dev);
1896 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1897 {
1898 /* Set interrupt pin 1 configuration */
1899 if((int_pin == BMI2_INT1) || (int_pin == BMI2_INT_BOTH))
1900 {
1901 /* Configure active low or high */
1902 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(data_array[0], BMI2_INT_LEVEL, int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].lvl);
1903
1904 /* Configure push-pull or open drain */
1905 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_INT_OPEN_DRAIN, int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].od);
1906
1907 /* Configure output enable */
1908 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_INT_OUTPUT_EN, int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].output_en);
1909
1910 /* Configure input enable */
1911 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_INT_INPUT_EN, int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].input_en);
1912
1913 /* Copy the data to be written in the respective array */
1914 data_array[0] = reg_data;
1915 }
1916
1917 /* Set interrupt pin 2 configuration */
1918 if((int_pin == BMI2_INT2) || (int_pin == BMI2_INT_BOTH))
1919 {
1920 /* Configure active low or high */
1921 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(data_array[1], BMI2_INT_LEVEL, int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].lvl);
1922
1923 /* Configure push-pull or open drain */
1924 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_INT_OPEN_DRAIN, int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].od);
1925
1926 /* Configure output enable */
1927 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_INT_OUTPUT_EN, int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].output_en);
1928
1929 /* Configure input enable */
1930 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_INT_INPUT_EN, int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].input_en);
1931
1932 /* Copy the data to be written in the respective array */
1933 data_array[1] = reg_data;
1934 }
1935
1936 /* Configure the interrupt mode */
1937 data_array[2] = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(data_array[2], BMI2_INT_LATCH, int_cfg->int_latch);
1938
1939 /* Set the configurations simultaneously as
1940 * INT1_IO_CTRL, INT2_IO_CTRL, and INT_LATCH lie
1941 * in consecutive addresses
1942 */
1943 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_INT1_IO_CTRL_ADDR, data_array, 3, dev);
1944 }
1945 }
1946 else
1947 {
1948 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_INT_PIN;
1949 }
1950 }
1951 else
1952 {
1953 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
1954 }
1955
1956 return rslt;
1957}
1958
1959
1974XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_int_pin_config(struct bmi2_int_pin_config *int_cfg, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
1975{
1976 /* Variable to define error */
1977 XBYTESIG rslt;
1978
1979 /* Variable to define data array */
1980 XBYTE data_array[3] = { 0 };
1981
1982 /* Variable to define type of interrupt pin */
1983 XBYTE int_pin = 0;
1984
1985 /* Null-pointer check */
1986 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
1987 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (int_cfg != NULL))
1988 {
1989 /* Copy the pin type to a local variable */
1990 int_pin = int_cfg->pin_type;
1991
1992 /* Get the previous configuration data */
1993 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_INT1_IO_CTRL_ADDR, data_array, 3, dev);
1994 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
1995 {
1996 /* Get interrupt pin 1 configuration */
1997 if((int_pin == BMI2_INT1) || (int_pin == BMI2_INT_BOTH))
1998 {
1999 /* Get active low or high */
2000 int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].lvl = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[0], BMI2_INT_LEVEL);
2001
2002 /* Get push-pull or open drain */
2003 int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].od = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[0], BMI2_INT_OPEN_DRAIN);
2004
2005 /* Get output enable */
2006 int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].output_en = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[0], BMI2_INT_OUTPUT_EN);
2007
2008 /* Get input enable */
2009 int_cfg->pin_cfg[0].input_en = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[0], BMI2_INT_INPUT_EN);
2010 }
2011
2012 /* Get interrupt pin 2 configuration */
2013 if((int_pin == BMI2_INT2) || (int_pin == BMI2_INT_BOTH))
2014 {
2015 /* Get active low or high */
2016 int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].lvl = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[1], BMI2_INT_LEVEL);
2017
2018 /* Get push-pull or open drain */
2019 int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].od = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[1], BMI2_INT_OPEN_DRAIN);
2020
2021 /* Get output enable */
2022 int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].output_en = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[1], BMI2_INT_OUTPUT_EN);
2023
2024 /* Get input enable */
2025 int_cfg->pin_cfg[1].input_en = BMI2_GET_BITS(data_array[1], BMI2_INT_INPUT_EN);
2026 }
2027
2028 /* Get interrupt mode */
2029 int_cfg->int_latch = BMI2_GET_BIT_POS0(data_array[2], BMI2_INT_LATCH);
2030 }
2031 }
2032 else
2033 {
2034 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2035 }
2036
2037 return rslt;
2038}
2039
2040
2053XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_int_status(XWORD *int_status, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2054{
2055 /* Variable to define error */
2056 XBYTESIG rslt;
2057
2058 /* Array to store data */
2059 XBYTE data_array[2] = { 0 };
2060
2061 /* Null-pointer check */
2062 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2063 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (int_status != NULL))
2064 {
2065 /* Get the interrupt status */
2066 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_INT_STATUS_0_ADDR, data_array, 2, dev);
2067 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2068 {
2069 *int_status = (XWORD) data_array[0] | ((XWORD) data_array[1] << 8);
2070 }
2071 }
2072 else
2073 {
2074 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2075 }
2076
2077 return rslt;
2078}
2079
2080
2094XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_sensor_enable(const XBYTE *sens_list, XBYTE n_sens, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2095{
2096 /* Variable to define error */
2097 XBYTESIG rslt;
2098
2099 /* Variable to select sensor */
2100 XQWORD sensor_sel = 0;
2101
2102 /* Null-pointer check */
2103 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2104 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (sens_list != NULL))
2105 {
2106 /* Get the selected sensors */
2107 rslt = select_sensor(sens_list, n_sens, &sensor_sel);
2108 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2109 {
2110 /* Enable the selected sensors */
2111 rslt = sensor_enable(sensor_sel, dev);
2112 }
2113 }
2114 else
2115 {
2116 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2117 }
2118
2119 return rslt;
2120}
2121
2122
2136XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_sensor_disable(const XBYTE *sens_list, XBYTE n_sens, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2137{
2138 /* Variable to define error */
2139 XBYTESIG rslt;
2140
2141 /* Variable to select sensor */
2142 XQWORD sensor_sel = 0;
2143
2144 /* Null-pointer check */
2145 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2146 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (sens_list != NULL))
2147 {
2148 /* Get the selected sensors */
2149 rslt = select_sensor(sens_list, n_sens, &sensor_sel);
2150 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2151 {
2152 /* Disable the selected sensors */
2153 rslt = sensor_disable(sensor_sel, dev);
2154 }
2155 }
2156 else
2157 {
2158 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2159 }
2160
2161 return rslt;
2162}
2163
2164
2178XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_sensor_config(struct bmi2_sens_config *sens_cfg, XBYTE n_sens, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2179{
2180 /* Variable to define error */
2181 XBYTESIG rslt;
2182
2183 /* Variable to define loop */
2184 XBYTE loop;
2185
2186 /* Variable to get the status of advance power save */
2187 XBYTE aps_stat = 0;
2188
2189 /* Null-pointer check */
2190 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2191 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (sens_cfg != NULL))
2192 {
2193 /* Get status of advance power save mode */
2194 aps_stat = dev->aps_status;
2195
2196 for (loop = 0; loop < n_sens; loop++)
2197 {
2198 /* Disable Advance power save if enabled for auxiliary
2199 * and feature configurations
2200 */
2201 if(aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE)
2202 {
2203 /* Disable advance power save if
2204 * enabled
2205 */
2206 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_DISABLE, dev);
2207 }
2208
2209 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2210 {
2211 switch (sens_cfg[loop].type)
2212 {
2213 /* Set accelerometer configuration */
2214 case BMI2_ACCEL:
2215 rslt = set_accel_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.acc, dev);
2216 break;
2217
2218 /* Set gyroscope configuration */
2219 case BMI2_GYRO:
2220 rslt = set_gyro_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.gyr, dev);
2221 break;
2222
2223 /* Set auxiliary configuration */
2224 case BMI2_AUX:
2225 rslt = set_aux_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.aux, dev);
2226 break;
2227
2228 /* Set gyroscope user gain configuration */
2229 case BMI2_GYRO_GAIN_UPDATE:
2230 rslt = set_gyro_user_gain_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.gyro_gain_update, dev);
2231 break;
2232
2233 default:
2234 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
2235 break;
2236 }
2237 }
2238
2239 /* Return error if any of the set configurations fail */
2240 if(rslt != BMI2_OK)
2241 {
2242 break;
2243 }
2244 }
2245
2246 /* Enable Advance power save if disabled while configuring and
2247 * not when already disabled
2248 */
2249 if((aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE) && (rslt == BMI2_OK))
2250 {
2251 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_ENABLE, dev);
2252 }
2253 }
2254 else
2255 {
2256 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2257 }
2258
2259 return rslt;
2260}
2261
2262
2276XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_sensor_config(struct bmi2_sens_config *sens_cfg, XBYTE n_sens, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2277{
2278 /* Variable to define error */
2279 XBYTESIG rslt;
2280
2281 /* Variable to define loop */
2282 XBYTE loop;
2283
2284 /* Variable to get the status of advance power save */
2285 XBYTE aps_stat = 0;
2286
2287 /* Null-pointer check */
2288 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2289 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (sens_cfg != NULL))
2290 {
2291 /* Get status of advance power save mode */
2292 aps_stat = dev->aps_status;
2293 for (loop = 0; loop < n_sens; loop++)
2294 {
2295 /* Disable Advance power save if enabled for auxiliary
2296 * and feature configurations
2297 */
2298 if((sens_cfg[loop].type >= BMI2_MAIN_SENS_MAX_NUM) || (sens_cfg[loop].type == BMI2_AUX))
2299 {
2300
2301 if(aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE)
2302 {
2303 /* Disable advance power save if
2304 * enabled
2305 */
2306 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_DISABLE, dev);
2307 }
2308 }
2309
2310 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2311 {
2312 switch (sens_cfg[loop].type)
2313 {
2314 /* Get accelerometer configuration */
2315 case BMI2_ACCEL:
2316 rslt = get_accel_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.acc, dev);
2317 break;
2318
2319 /* Get gyroscope configuration */
2320 case BMI2_GYRO:
2321 rslt = get_gyro_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.gyr, dev);
2322 break;
2323
2324 /* Get auxiliary configuration */
2325 case BMI2_AUX:
2326 rslt = get_aux_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.aux, dev);
2327 break;
2328
2329 /* Get gyroscope user gain configuration */
2330 case BMI2_GYRO_GAIN_UPDATE:
2331 rslt = get_gyro_gain_update_config(&sens_cfg[loop].cfg.gyro_gain_update, dev);
2332 break;
2333
2334 default:
2335 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
2336 break;
2337 }
2338 }
2339
2340 /* Return error if any of the get configurations fail */
2341 if(rslt != BMI2_OK)
2342 {
2343 break;
2344 }
2345 }
2346
2347 /* Enable Advance power save if disabled while configuring and
2348 * not when already disabled
2349 */
2350 if((aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE) && (rslt == BMI2_OK))
2351 {
2352 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_ENABLE, dev);
2353 }
2354 }
2355 else
2356 {
2357 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2358 }
2359
2360 return rslt;
2361}
2362
2363
2379XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_sensor_data(struct bmi2_sensor_data *sensor_data, XBYTE n_sens, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2380{
2381 /* Variable to define error */
2382 XBYTESIG rslt;
2383
2384 /* Variable to define loop */
2385 XBYTE loop;
2386
2387 /* Variable to get the status of advance power save */
2388 XBYTE aps_stat = 0;
2389
2390 /* Null-pointer check */
2391 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2392 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (sensor_data != NULL))
2393 {
2394 /* Get status of advance power save mode */
2395 aps_stat = dev->aps_status;
2396 for (loop = 0; loop < n_sens; loop++)
2397 {
2398 /* Disable Advance power save if enabled for feature
2399 * configurations
2400 */
2401 if(sensor_data[loop].type >= BMI2_MAIN_SENS_MAX_NUM)
2402 {
2403 if(aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE)
2404 {
2405 /* Disable advance power save if
2406 * enabled
2407 */
2408 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_DISABLE, dev);
2409 }
2410 }
2411
2412 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2413 {
2414 switch (sensor_data[loop].type)
2415 {
2416 case BMI2_ACCEL:
2417
2418 /* Get accelerometer data */
2419 rslt = get_accel_sensor_data(&sensor_data[loop].sens_data.acc, BMI2_ACC_X_LSB_ADDR, dev);
2420 break;
2421 case BMI2_GYRO:
2422
2423 /* Get gyroscope data */
2424 rslt = get_gyro_sensor_data(&sensor_data[loop].sens_data.gyr, BMI2_GYR_X_LSB_ADDR, dev);
2425 break;
2426 case BMI2_AUX:
2427
2428 /* Get auxiliary sensor data in data mode */
2429 rslt = read_aux_data_mode(sensor_data[loop].sens_data.aux_data, dev);
2430 break;
2431
2432 case BMI2_GYRO_CROSS_SENSE:
2433
2434 /* Get Gyroscope cross sense value of z axis */
2435 rslt = get_gyro_cross_sense(&sensor_data[loop].sens_data.correction_factor_zx, dev);
2436 break;
2437
2438 case BMI2_GYRO_GAIN_UPDATE:
2439
2440 /* Get saturation status of gyroscope user gain update */
2441 rslt = get_gyro_gain_update_status(&sensor_data[loop].sens_data.gyro_user_gain_status, dev);
2442 break;
2443 default:
2444 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
2445 break;
2446 }
2447
2448 /* Return error if any of the get sensor data fails */
2449 if(rslt != BMI2_OK)
2450 {
2451 break;
2452 }
2453 }
2454
2455 /* Enable Advance power save if disabled while
2456 * configuring and not when already disabled
2457 */
2458 if((aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE) && (rslt == BMI2_OK))
2459 {
2460 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_ENABLE, dev);
2461 }
2462 }
2463 }
2464 else
2465 {
2466 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2467 }
2468
2469 return rslt;
2470}
2471
2472
2486XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_fifo_config(XWORD config, XBYTE enable, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2487{
2488 XBYTESIG rslt;
2489 XBYTE data[2] = { 0 };
2490 XBYTE max_burst_len = 0;
2491
2492 /* Variable to store data of FIFO configuration register 0 */
2493 XBYTE fifo_config_0 = (XBYTE)(config & BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_0_MASK);
2494
2495 /* Variable to store data of FIFO configuration register 1 */
2496 XBYTE fifo_config_1 = (XBYTE)((config & BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_1_MASK) >> 8);
2497
2498 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2499 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2500 {
2501 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_0_ADDR, data, BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_LENGTH, dev);
2502 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2503 {
2504 /* Get data to set FIFO configuration register 0 */
2505 if(fifo_config_0 > 0)
2506 {
2507 if(enable == BMI2_ENABLE)
2508 {
2509 data[0] = data[0] | fifo_config_0;
2510 }
2511 else
2512 {
2513 data[0] = data[0] & (~fifo_config_0);
2514 }
2515 }
2516
2517 /* Get data to set FIFO configuration register 1 */
2518 if(enable == BMI2_ENABLE)
2519 {
2520 data[1] = data[1] | fifo_config_1;
2521 if(dev->variant_feature & BMI2_CRT_RTOSK_ENABLE)
2522 {
2523
2524 /* Burst length is needed for CRT
2525 * FIFO enable will reset the default values
2526 * So configure the max burst length again.
2527 */
2528 rslt = get_maxburst_len(&max_burst_len, dev);
2529 if(rslt == BMI2_OK && max_burst_len == 0)
2530 {
2531 rslt = set_maxburst_len(BMI2_CRT_MIN_BURST_WORD_LENGTH, dev);
2532 }
2533 }
2534 }
2535 else
2536 {
2537 data[1] = data[1] & (~fifo_config_1);
2538 }
2539
2540 /* Set the FIFO configurations */
2541 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2542 {
2543 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_0_ADDR, data, 2, dev);
2544 }
2545 }
2546 }
2547
2548 return rslt;
2549}
2550
2551
2564XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_fifo_config(XWORD *fifo_config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2565{
2566 /* Variable to define error */
2567 XBYTESIG rslt;
2568
2569 /* Array to store data */
2570 XBYTE data[2] = { 0 };
2571
2572 /* Null-pointer check */
2573 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2574 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (fifo_config != NULL))
2575 {
2576 /* Get the FIFO configuration value */
2577 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_0_ADDR, data, BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_LENGTH, dev);
2578 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2579 {
2580 (*fifo_config) = (XWORD)((XWORD) data[0] & BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_0_MASK);
2581 (*fifo_config) |= (XWORD)(((XWORD) data[1] << 8) & BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_1_MASK);
2582 }
2583 }
2584 else
2585 {
2586 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2587 }
2588
2589 return rslt;
2590}
2591
2592
2605XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_read_fifo_data(struct bmi2_fifo_frame *fifo, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2606{
2607 /* Variable to define error */
2608 XBYTESIG rslt;
2609
2610 /* Array to store FIFO configuration data */
2611 XBYTE config_data[2] = { 0 };
2612
2613 /* Variable to define FIFO address */
2614 XBYTE addr = BMI2_FIFO_DATA_ADDR;
2615
2616 /* Null-pointer check */
2617 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2618 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (fifo != NULL))
2619 {
2620 /* Clear the FIFO data structure */
2621 reset_fifo_frame_structure(fifo, dev);
2622
2623 /* Read FIFO data */
2624 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(addr, fifo->data, fifo->length, dev);
2625
2626 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2627 {
2628
2629 /* Get the set FIFO frame configurations */
2630 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_CONFIG_0_ADDR, config_data, 2, dev);
2631 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2632 {
2633 /* Get FIFO header status */
2634 fifo->header_enable = (XBYTE)((config_data[1]) & (BMI2_FIFO_HEADER_EN >> 8));
2635
2636 /* Get sensor enable status, of which the data is to be read */
2637 fifo->data_enable =
2638 (XWORD)(((config_data[0]) | ((XWORD) config_data[1] << 8)) & BMI2_FIFO_ALL_EN);
2639 }
2640 }
2641 else
2642 {
2643 rslt = BMI2_E_COM_FAIL;
2644 }
2645 }
2646 else
2647 {
2648 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2649 }
2650
2651 return rslt;
2652}
2653
2654
2671XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_extract_accel(struct bmi2_sens_axes_data* accel_data, XWORD* accel_length, struct bmi2_fifo_frame* fifo, const struct bmi2_dev* dev)
2672{
2673 /* Variable to define error */
2674 XBYTESIG rslt;
2675
2676 /* Variable to index the bytes */
2677 XWORD data_index = 0;
2678
2679 /* Variable to index accelerometer frames */
2680 XWORD accel_index = 0;
2681
2682 /* Variable to store the number of bytes to be read */
2683 XWORD data_read_length = 0;
2684
2685 /* Variable to define the data enable byte */
2686 XBYTE data_enable = 0;
2687
2688 /* Null-pointer check */
2689 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2690 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (accel_data != NULL) && (accel_length != NULL) && (fifo != NULL))
2691 {
2692 /* Parsing the FIFO data in header-less mode */
2693 if(fifo->header_enable == 0)
2694 {
2695
2696 /* Get the number of accelerometer bytes to be read */
2697 rslt = parse_fifo_accel_len(&data_index, &data_read_length, accel_length, fifo);
2698
2699 /* Convert word to byte since all sensor enables are in a byte */
2700 data_enable = (XBYTE)(fifo->data_enable >> 8);
2701 for (; (data_index < data_read_length) && (rslt != BMI2_W_FIFO_EMPTY);)
2702 {
2703 /* Unpack frame to get the accelerometer data */
2704 rslt = unpack_accel_frame(accel_data, &data_index, &accel_index, data_enable, fifo, dev);
2705
2706 if(rslt != BMI2_W_FIFO_EMPTY)
2707 {
2708 /* Check for the availability of next two bytes of FIFO data */
2709 rslt = check_empty_fifo(&data_index, fifo);
2710 }
2711 }
2712
2713 /* Update number of accelerometer frames to be read */
2714 (*accel_length) = accel_index;
2715
2716 /* Update the accelerometer byte index */
2717 fifo->acc_byte_start_idx = data_index;
2718 }
2719 else
2720 {
2721 /* Parsing the FIFO data in header mode */
2722 rslt = extract_accel_header_mode(accel_data, accel_length, fifo, dev);
2723 }
2724 }
2725 else
2726 {
2727 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2728 }
2729
2730 return rslt;
2731}
2732
2733
2750XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_extract_gyro(struct bmi2_sens_axes_data *gyro_data, XWORD *gyro_length, struct bmi2_fifo_frame *fifo, const struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2751{
2752 /* Variable to define error */
2753 XBYTESIG rslt;
2754
2755 /* Variable to index the bytes */
2756 XWORD data_index = 0;
2757
2758 /* Variable to index gyroscope frames */
2759 XWORD gyro_index = 0;
2760
2761 /* Variable to store the number of bytes to be read */
2762 XWORD data_read_length = 0;
2763
2764 /* Variable to define the data enable byte */
2765 XBYTE data_enable = 0;
2766
2767 /* Null-pointer check */
2768 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2769 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (gyro_data != NULL) && (gyro_length != NULL) && (fifo != NULL))
2770 {
2771 /* Parsing the FIFO data in header-less mode */
2772 if(fifo->header_enable == 0)
2773 {
2774 /* Get the number of gyro bytes to be read */
2775 rslt = parse_fifo_gyro_len(&data_index, &data_read_length, gyro_length, fifo);
2776
2777 /* Convert word to byte since all sensor enables are in a byte */
2778 data_enable = (XBYTE)(fifo->data_enable >> 8);
2779 for (; (data_index < data_read_length) && (rslt != BMI2_W_FIFO_EMPTY);)
2780 {
2781 /* Unpack frame to get gyroscope data */
2782 rslt = unpack_gyro_frame(gyro_data, &data_index, &gyro_index, data_enable, fifo, dev);
2783 if(rslt != BMI2_W_FIFO_EMPTY)
2784 {
2785 /* Check for the availability of next two bytes of FIFO data */
2786 rslt = check_empty_fifo(&data_index, fifo);
2787 }
2788 }
2789
2790 /* Update number of gyroscope frames to be read */
2791 (*gyro_length) = gyro_index;
2792
2793 /* Update the gyroscope byte index */
2794 fifo->acc_byte_start_idx = data_index;
2795 }
2796 else
2797 {
2798 /* Parsing the FIFO data in header mode */
2799 rslt = extract_gyro_header_mode(gyro_data, gyro_length, fifo, dev);
2800 }
2801 }
2802 else
2803 {
2804 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2805 }
2806
2807 return rslt;
2808}
2809
2810
2826XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_extract_aux(struct bmi2_aux_fifo_data *aux, XWORD *aux_length, struct bmi2_fifo_frame *fifo, const struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2827{
2828 /* Variable to define error */
2829 XBYTESIG rslt;
2830
2831 /* Variable to index the bytes */
2832 XWORD data_index = 0;
2833
2834 /* Variable to index auxiliary frames */
2835 XWORD aux_index = 0;
2836
2837 /* Variable to store the number of bytes to be read */
2838 XWORD data_read_length = 0;
2839
2840 /* Variable to define the data enable byte */
2841 XBYTE data_enable = 0;
2842
2843 /* Null-pointer check */
2844 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2845 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aux != NULL) && (aux_length != NULL) && (fifo != NULL))
2846 {
2847 /* Parsing the FIFO data in header-less mode */
2848 if(fifo->header_enable == 0)
2849 {
2850 rslt = parse_fifo_aux_len(&data_index, &data_read_length, aux_length, fifo);
2851
2852 /* Convert word to byte since all sensor enables are in
2853 * a byte
2854 */
2855 data_enable = (XBYTE)(fifo->data_enable >> 8);
2856 for (; (data_index < data_read_length) && (rslt != BMI2_W_FIFO_EMPTY);)
2857 {
2858 /* Unpack frame to get auxiliary data */
2859 rslt = unpack_aux_frame(aux, &data_index, &aux_index, data_enable, fifo, dev);
2860 if(rslt != BMI2_W_FIFO_EMPTY)
2861 {
2862 /* Check for the availability of next
2863 * two bytes of FIFO data
2864 */
2865 rslt = check_empty_fifo(&data_index, fifo);
2866 }
2867 }
2868
2869 /* Update number of auxiliary frames to be read */
2870 *aux_length = aux_index;
2871
2872 /* Update the auxiliary byte index */
2873 fifo->aux_byte_start_idx = data_index;
2874 }
2875 else
2876 {
2877 /* Parsing the FIFO data in header mode */
2878 rslt = extract_aux_header_mode(aux, aux_length, fifo, dev);
2879 }
2880 }
2881 else
2882 {
2883 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2884 }
2885
2886 return rslt;
2887}
2888
2889
2902XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_command_register(XBYTE command, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2903{
2904 /* Variable to define error */
2905 XBYTESIG rslt;
2906
2907 /* Null-pointer check */
2908 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2909 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2910 {
2911 /* Set the command in the command register */
2912 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_CMD_REG_ADDR, &command, 1, dev);
2913 }
2914
2915 return rslt;
2916}
2917
2918
2931XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_fifo_self_wake_up(XBYTE fifo_self_wake_up, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2932{
2933 /* Variable to define error */
2934 XBYTESIG rslt;
2935
2936 /* Variable to store data */
2937 XBYTE data = 0;
2938
2939 /* Null-pointer check */
2940 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2941 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2942 {
2943 /* Set FIFO self wake-up */
2944 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_PWR_CONF_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
2945 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2946 {
2947 data = BMI2_SET_BITS(data, BMI2_FIFO_SELF_WAKE_UP, fifo_self_wake_up);
2948 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_PWR_CONF_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
2949 }
2950 }
2951
2952 return rslt;
2953}
2954
2955
2968XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_fifo_self_wake_up(XBYTE *fifo_self_wake_up, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
2969{
2970 /* Variable to define error */
2971 XBYTESIG rslt;
2972
2973 /* Variable to store data */
2974 XBYTE data = 0;
2975
2976 /* Null-pointer check */
2977 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
2978 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (fifo_self_wake_up != NULL))
2979 {
2980 /* Get the status of FIFO self wake-up */
2981 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_PWR_CONF_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
2982 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
2983 {
2984 (*fifo_self_wake_up) = BMI2_GET_BITS(data, BMI2_FIFO_SELF_WAKE_UP);
2985 }
2986 }
2987 else
2988 {
2989 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
2990 }
2991
2992 return rslt;
2993}
2994
2995
3008XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_fifo_wm(XWORD fifo_wm, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3009{
3010 /* Variable to define error */
3011 XBYTESIG rslt;
3012
3013 /* Array to store data */
3014 XBYTE data[2] = { 0 };
3015
3016 /* Null-pointer check */
3017 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3018 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3019 {
3020 /* Get LSB value of FIFO water-mark */
3021 data[0] = BMI2_GET_LSB(fifo_wm);
3022
3023 /* Get MSB value of FIFO water-mark */
3024 data[1] = BMI2_GET_MSB(fifo_wm);
3025
3026 /* Set the FIFO water-mark level */
3027 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FIFO_WTM_0_ADDR, data, 2, dev);
3028 }
3029
3030 return rslt;
3031}
3032
3033
3046XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_fifo_wm(XWORD *fifo_wm, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3047{
3048 /* Variable to define error */
3049 XBYTESIG rslt;
3050
3051 /* Array to to store data */
3052 XBYTE data[2] = { 0 };
3053
3054 /* Null-pointer check */
3055 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3056 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (fifo_wm != NULL))
3057 {
3058 /* Read the FIFO water mark level */
3059 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_WTM_0_ADDR, data, BMI2_FIFO_WM_LENGTH, dev);
3060 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3061 {
3062 (*fifo_wm) = (XWORD)((XWORD) data[1] << 8) | (data[0]);
3063 }
3064 }
3065 else
3066 {
3067 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3068 }
3069
3070 return rslt;
3071}
3072
3073
3087XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_fifo_filter_data(XBYTE sens_sel, XBYTE fifo_filter_data, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3088{
3089 /* Variable to define error */
3090 XBYTESIG rslt;
3091
3092 /* Variable to store data */
3093 XBYTE data = 0;
3094
3095 /* Null-pointer check */
3096 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3097 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3098 {
3099 switch (sens_sel)
3100 {
3101 case BMI2_ACCEL:
3102
3103 /* Validate filter mode */
3104 if(fifo_filter_data <= BMI2_MAX_VALUE_FIFO_FILTER)
3105 {
3106 /* Set the accelerometer FIFO filter data */
3107 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3108 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3109 {
3110 data = BMI2_SET_BITS(data, BMI2_ACC_FIFO_FILT_DATA, fifo_filter_data);
3111 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3112 }
3113 }
3114 else
3115 {
3116 rslt = BMI2_E_OUT_OF_RANGE;
3117 }
3118
3119 break;
3120 case BMI2_GYRO:
3121
3122 /* Validate filter mode */
3123 if(fifo_filter_data <= BMI2_MAX_VALUE_FIFO_FILTER)
3124 {
3125 /* Set the gyroscope FIFO filter data */
3126 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3127 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3128 {
3129 data = BMI2_SET_BITS(data, BMI2_GYR_FIFO_FILT_DATA, fifo_filter_data);
3130 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3131 }
3132 }
3133 else
3134 {
3135 rslt = BMI2_E_OUT_OF_RANGE;
3136 }
3137
3138 break;
3139 default:
3140 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
3141 break;
3142 }
3143 }
3144
3145 return rslt;
3146}
3147
3148
3162XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_fifo_filter_data(XBYTE sens_sel, XBYTE *fifo_filter_data, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3163{
3164 /* Variable to define error */
3165 XBYTESIG rslt;
3166
3167 /* Variable to store FIFO filter mode */
3168 XBYTE data = 0;
3169
3170 /* Null-pointer check */
3171 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3172 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (fifo_filter_data != NULL))
3173 {
3174 switch (sens_sel)
3175 {
3176 case BMI2_ACCEL:
3177
3178 /* Read the accelerometer FIFO filter data */
3179 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3180 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3181 {
3182 (*fifo_filter_data) = BMI2_GET_BITS(data, BMI2_ACC_FIFO_FILT_DATA);
3183 }
3184
3185 break;
3186 case BMI2_GYRO:
3187
3188 /* Read the gyroscope FIFO filter data */
3189 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3190 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3191 {
3192 (*fifo_filter_data) = BMI2_GET_BITS(data, BMI2_GYR_FIFO_FILT_DATA);
3193 }
3194
3195 break;
3196 default:
3197 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
3198 break;
3199 }
3200 }
3201 else
3202 {
3203 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3204 }
3205
3206 return rslt;
3207}
3208
3209
3223XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_fifo_down_sample(XBYTE sens_sel, XBYTE fifo_down_samp, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3224{
3225 /* Variable to define error */
3226 XBYTESIG rslt;
3227
3228 /* Variable to store sampling rate */
3229 XBYTE data = 0;
3230
3231 /* Null-pointer check */
3232 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3233 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3234 {
3235 switch (sens_sel)
3236 {
3237 case BMI2_ACCEL:
3238
3239 /* Set the accelerometer FIFO down sampling rate */
3240 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3241 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3242 {
3243 data = BMI2_SET_BITS(data, BMI2_ACC_FIFO_DOWNS, fifo_down_samp);
3244 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3245 }
3246
3247 break;
3248 case BMI2_GYRO:
3249
3250 /* Set the gyroscope FIFO down sampling rate */
3251 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3252 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3253 {
3254 data = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(data, BMI2_GYR_FIFO_DOWNS, fifo_down_samp);
3255 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3256 }
3257
3258 break;
3259 default:
3260 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
3261 break;
3262 }
3263 }
3264
3265 return rslt;
3266}
3267
3268
3283XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_fifo_down_sample(XBYTE sens_sel, XBYTE *fifo_down_samp, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3284{
3285 /* Variable to define error */
3286 XBYTESIG rslt;
3287
3288 /* Variable to store sampling rate */
3289 XBYTE data = 0;
3290
3291 /* Null-pointer check */
3292 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3293 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (fifo_down_samp != NULL))
3294 {
3295 switch (sens_sel)
3296 {
3297 case BMI2_ACCEL:
3298
3299 /* Read the accelerometer FIFO down data sampling rate */
3300 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3301 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3302 {
3303 (*fifo_down_samp) = BMI2_GET_BITS(data, BMI2_ACC_FIFO_DOWNS);
3304 }
3305
3306 break;
3307 case BMI2_GYRO:
3308
3309 /* Read the gyroscope FIFO down data sampling rate */
3310 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_DOWNS_ADDR, &data, 1, dev);
3311 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3312 {
3313 (*fifo_down_samp) = BMI2_GET_BIT_POS0(data, BMI2_GYR_FIFO_DOWNS);
3314 }
3315
3316 break;
3317 default:
3318 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
3319 break;
3320 }
3321 }
3322 else
3323 {
3324 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3325 }
3326
3327 return rslt;
3328}
3329
3330
3343XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_fifo_length(XWORD *fifo_length, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3344{
3345 /* Variable to define error */
3346 XBYTESIG rslt;
3347
3348 /* Variable to define byte index */
3349 XBYTE index = 0;
3350
3351 /* Array to store FIFO data length */
3352 XBYTE data[BMI2_FIFO_DATA_LENGTH] = { 0 };
3353
3354 /* Null-pointer check */
3355 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3356 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (fifo_length != NULL))
3357 {
3358 /* Read FIFO length */
3359 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_FIFO_LENGTH_0_ADDR, data, BMI2_FIFO_DATA_LENGTH, dev);
3360 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3361 {
3362 /* Get the MSB byte index */
3363 index = BMI2_FIFO_LENGTH_MSB_BYTE;
3364
3365 /* Get the MSB byte of FIFO length */
3366 data[index] = BMI2_GET_BIT_POS0(data[index], BMI2_FIFO_BYTE_COUNTER_MSB);
3367
3368 /* Get total FIFO length */
3369 (*fifo_length) = ((data[index] << 8) | data[index - 1]);
3370 }
3371 }
3372 else
3373 {
3374 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3375 }
3376
3377 return rslt;
3378}
3379
3380
3397XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_read_aux_man_mode(XBYTE reg_addr, XBYTE *aux_data, XWORD len, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3398{
3399 /* Variable to define error */
3400 XBYTESIG rslt;
3401
3402 /* Variable to store burst length */
3403 XBYTE burst_len = 0;
3404
3405 /* Variable to define APS status */
3406 XBYTE aps_stat = 0;
3407
3408 /* Null-pointer check */
3409 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3410 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aux_data != NULL))
3411 {
3412 /* Validate if manual mode */
3413 if(dev->aux_man_en)
3414 {
3415 /* Get status of advance power save mode */
3416 aps_stat = dev->aps_status;
3417 if(aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE)
3418 {
3419 /* Disable APS if enabled */
3420 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_DISABLE, dev);
3421 }
3422
3423 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3424 {
3425 /* Map the register value set to that of burst
3426 * length
3427 */
3428 rslt = map_read_len(&burst_len, dev);
3429 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3430 {
3431 /* Read auxiliary data */
3432 rslt = read_aux_data(reg_addr, aux_data, len, burst_len, dev);
3433 }
3434 }
3435
3436 /* Enable Advance power save if disabled for reading
3437 * data and not when already disabled
3438 */
3439 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE))
3440 {
3441 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_ENABLE, dev);
3442 }
3443 }
3444 else
3445 {
3446 rslt = BMI2_E_AUX_INVALID_CFG;
3447 }
3448 }
3449 else
3450 {
3451 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3452 }
3453
3454 return rslt;
3455}
3456
3457
3474XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_write_aux_man_mode(XBYTE reg_addr, const XBYTE *aux_data, XWORD len, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3475{
3476 /* Variable to define error */
3477 XBYTESIG rslt;
3478
3479 /* Variable to define loop */
3480 XBYTE loop = 0;
3481
3482 /* Variable to define APS status */
3483 XBYTE aps_stat = 0;
3484
3485 /* Null-pointer check */
3486 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3487 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aux_data != NULL))
3488 {
3489 /* Validate if manual mode */
3490 if(dev->aux_man_en)
3491 {
3492 /* Get status of advance power save mode */
3493 aps_stat = dev->aps_status;
3494 if(aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE)
3495 {
3496 /* Disable APS if enabled */
3497 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_DISABLE, dev);
3498 }
3499
3500 /* Byte write data in the corresponding address */
3501 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3502 {
3503 for (; ((loop < len) && (rslt == BMI2_OK)); loop++)
3504 {
3505 rslt = write_aux_data((reg_addr + loop), aux_data[loop], dev);
3506 //dev->delay_us(1000, dev->intf_ptr);
3507 bmi2_delay_us(1000, dev->intf_ptr);
3508 }
3509 }
3510
3511 /* Enable Advance power save if disabled for writing
3512 * data and not when already disabled
3513 */
3514 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE))
3515 {
3516 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_ENABLE, dev);
3517 }
3518 }
3519 else
3520 {
3521 rslt = BMI2_E_AUX_INVALID_CFG;
3522 }
3523 }
3524 else
3525 {
3526 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3527 }
3528
3529 return rslt;
3530}
3531
3532
3549XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_write_aux_interleaved(XBYTE reg_addr, const XBYTE *aux_data, XWORD len, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3550{
3551 /* Variable to define error */
3552 XBYTESIG rslt;
3553
3554 /* Variable to define loop */
3555 XBYTE loop = 1;
3556
3557 /* Variable to define APS status */
3558 XBYTE aps_stat = 0;
3559
3560 /* Null-pointer check */
3561 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3562 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aux_data != NULL))
3563 {
3564 /* Validate if manual mode */
3565 if(dev->aux_man_en)
3566 {
3567 /* Get status of advance power save mode */
3568 aps_stat = dev->aps_status;
3569 if(aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE)
3570 {
3571 /* Disable APS if enabled */
3572 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_DISABLE, dev);
3573 }
3574
3575 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3576 {
3577 /* Write the start register address extracted
3578 * from the interleaved data
3579 */
3580 rslt = write_aux_data(reg_addr, aux_data[0], dev);
3581
3582 /* Extract the remaining address and data from
3583 * the interleaved data and write it in the
3584 * corresponding addresses byte by byte
3585 */
3586 for (; ((loop < len) && (rslt == BMI2_OK)); loop += 2)
3587 {
3588 rslt = write_aux_data(aux_data[loop], aux_data[loop + 1], dev);
3589 //dev->delay_us(1000, dev->intf_ptr);
3590 bmi2_delay_us(1000, dev->intf_ptr);
3591 }
3592
3593 /* Enable Advance power save if disabled for
3594 * writing data and not when already disabled
3595 */
3596 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE))
3597 {
3598 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_ENABLE, dev);
3599 }
3600 }
3601 }
3602 else
3603 {
3604 rslt = BMI2_E_AUX_INVALID_CFG;
3605 }
3606 }
3607 else
3608 {
3609 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3610 }
3611
3612 return rslt;
3613}
3614
3615
3629XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_status(XBYTE *status, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3630{
3631 /* Variable to define error */
3632 XBYTESIG rslt;
3633
3634 /* Null-pointer check */
3635 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3636 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (status != NULL))
3637 {
3638 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_STATUS_ADDR, status, 1, dev);
3639 }
3640 else
3641 {
3642 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3643 }
3644
3645 return rslt;
3646}
3647
3648
3661XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_set_ois_interface(XBYTE enable, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3662{
3663 /* Variable to define error */
3664 XBYTESIG rslt;
3665
3666 /* Variable to store data */
3667 XBYTE reg_data = 0;
3668
3669 /* Null-pointer check */
3670 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3671 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3672 {
3673 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_IF_CONF_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
3674 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3675 {
3676 /* Enable/Disable OIS interface */
3677 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_OIS_IF_EN, enable);
3678 if(enable)
3679 {
3680 /* Disable auxiliary interface if OIS is enabled */
3681 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BIT_VAL0(reg_data, BMI2_AUX_IF_EN);
3682 }
3683
3684 /* Set the OIS interface configurations */
3685 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_IF_CONF_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
3686 }
3687 }
3688
3689 return rslt;
3690}
3691
3696XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_write_sync_commands(const XBYTE *command, XBYTE n_comm, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3697{
3698 /* Variable to define error */
3699 XBYTESIG rslt;
3700
3701 /* Null-pointer check */
3702 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3703 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (command != NULL))
3704 {
3705 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_SYNC_COMMAND_ADDR, command, n_comm, dev);
3706 }
3707 else
3708 {
3709 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3710 }
3711
3712 return rslt;
3713}
3714
3719XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_perform_accel_self_test(struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3720{
3721 /* Variable to define error */
3722 XBYTESIG rslt;
3723
3724 /* Variable to store self-test result */
3725 XBYTESIG st_rslt = 0;
3726
3727 /* Structure to define positive accelerometer axes */
3728 struct bmi2_sens_axes_data positive = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
3729
3730 /* Structure to define negative accelerometer axes */
3731 struct bmi2_sens_axes_data negative = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
3732
3733 /* Structure for difference of accelerometer values in g */
3734 struct bmi2_selftest_delta_limit accel_data_diff = { 0, 0, 0 };
3735
3736 /* Structure for difference of accelerometer values in mg */
3737 struct bmi2_selftest_delta_limit accel_data_diff_mg = { 0, 0, 0 };
3738
3739 /* Initialize the polarity of self-test as positive */
3740 XBYTESIG sign = BMI2_ENABLE;
3741
3742 /* Null-pointer check */
3743 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3744 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3745 {
3746 /* Sets the configuration required before enabling self-test */
3747 rslt = pre_self_test_config(dev);
3748
3749 /* Wait for greater than 2 milliseconds */
3750 //dev->delay_us(3000, dev->intf_ptr);
3751 bmi2_delay_us(3000, dev->intf_ptr);
3752
3753 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3754 {
3755 do
3756 {
3757 /* Select positive first, then negative polarity
3758 * after enabling self-test
3759 */
3760 rslt = self_test_config((XBYTE) sign, dev);
3761 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3762 {
3763 /* Wait for greater than 50 milli-sec */
3764 //dev->delay_us(51000, dev->intf_ptr);
3765 bmi2_delay_us(51000, dev->intf_ptr);
3766
3767 /* If polarity is positive */
3768 if(sign == BMI2_ENABLE)
3769 {
3770 /* Read and store positive acceleration value */
3771 rslt = read_accel_xyz(&positive, dev);
3772 }
3773 /* If polarity is negative */
3774 else if(sign == BMI2_DISABLE)
3775 {
3776 /* Read and store negative acceleration value */
3777 rslt = read_accel_xyz(&negative, dev);
3778 }
3779 }
3780 else
3781 {
3782 /* Break if error */
3783 break;
3784 }
3785
3786 /* Break if error */
3787 if(rslt != BMI2_OK)
3788 {
3789 break;
3790 }
3791
3792 /* Turn the polarity of self-test negative */
3793 sign--;
3794 } while (sign >= 0);
3795 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3796 {
3797 /* Subtract -ve acceleration values from that of +ve values */
3798 accel_data_diff.x = (positive.x) - (negative.x);
3799 accel_data_diff.y = (positive.y) - (negative.y);
3800 accel_data_diff.z = (positive.z) - (negative.z);
3801
3802 /* Convert differences of acceleration values
3803 * from 'g' to 'mg'
3804 */
3805 convert_lsb_g(&accel_data_diff, &accel_data_diff_mg, dev);
3806
3807 /* Validate self-test for acceleration values
3808 * in mg and get the self-test result
3809 */
3810 st_rslt = validate_self_test(&accel_data_diff_mg);
3811
3812 /* Trigger a soft reset after performing self-test */
3813 rslt = bmi2_soft_reset(dev);
3814
3815 /* Return the self-test result */
3816 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3817 {
3818 rslt = st_rslt;
3819 }
3820 }
3821 }
3822 }
3823
3824 return rslt;
3825}
3826
3830XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_map_feat_int(XBYTE type, enum bmi2_hw_int_pin hw_int_pin, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3831{
3832 /* Variable to define error */
3833 XBYTESIG rslt;
3834
3835 /* Variable to define the value of feature interrupts */
3836 XBYTE feat_int = 0;
3837
3838 /* Array to store the interrupt mask bits */
3839 XBYTE data_array[2] = { 0 };
3840
3841 /* Structure to define map the interrupts */
3842 struct bmi2_map_int map_int = { 0 };
3843
3844 /* Null-pointer check */
3845 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3846 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3847 {
3848 /* Read interrupt map1 and map2 and register */
3849 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_INT1_MAP_FEAT_ADDR, data_array, 2, dev);
3850
3851 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3852 {
3853 /* Get the value of the feature interrupt to be mapped */
3854 extract_feat_int_map(&map_int, type, dev);
3855
3856 feat_int = map_int.sens_map_int;
3857
3858 /* Map the interrupts */
3859 rslt = map_feat_int(data_array, hw_int_pin, feat_int);
3860
3861 /* Map the interrupts to INT1 and INT2 map register */
3862 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3863 {
3864 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_INT1_MAP_FEAT_ADDR, &data_array[0], 1, dev);
3865 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3866 {
3867 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_INT2_MAP_FEAT_ADDR, &data_array[1], 1, dev);
3868 }
3869 }
3870 }
3871 }
3872 else
3873 {
3874 rslt = BMI2_E_NULL_PTR;
3875 }
3876
3877 return rslt;
3878}
3879
3883XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_map_data_int(XBYTE data_int, enum bmi2_hw_int_pin int_pin, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3884{
3885 /* Variable to define error */
3886 XBYTESIG rslt;
3887
3888 /* Variable to mask interrupt pin 1 - lower nibble */
3889 XBYTE int1_mask = data_int;
3890
3891 /* Variable to mask interrupt pin 2 - higher nibble */
3892 XBYTE int2_mask = (XBYTE)(data_int << 4);
3893
3894 /* Variable to store register data */
3895 XBYTE reg_data = 0;
3896
3897 /* Read interrupt map1 and map2 and register */
3898 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_INT_MAP_DATA_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
3899 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3900 {
3901 if(int_pin < BMI2_INT_PIN_MAX)
3902 {
3903 switch (int_pin)
3904 {
3905 case BMI2_INT_NONE:
3906
3907 /* Un-Map the corresponding data
3908 * interrupt to both interrupt pin 1 and 2
3909 */
3910 reg_data &= ~(int1_mask | int2_mask);
3911 break;
3912 case BMI2_INT1:
3913
3914 /* Map the corresponding data interrupt to
3915 * interrupt pin 1
3916 */
3917 reg_data |= int1_mask;
3918 break;
3919 case BMI2_INT2:
3920
3921 /* Map the corresponding data interrupt to
3922 * interrupt pin 2
3923 */
3924 reg_data |= int2_mask;
3925 break;
3926 case BMI2_INT_BOTH:
3927
3928 /* Map the corresponding data
3929 * interrupt to both interrupt pin 1 and 2
3930 */
3931 reg_data |= (int1_mask | int2_mask);
3932 break;
3933 default:
3934 break;
3935 }
3936
3937 /* Set the interrupts in the map register */
3938 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_INT_MAP_DATA_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
3939 }
3940 else
3941 {
3942 /* Return error if invalid pin selection */
3943 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_INT_PIN;
3944 }
3945 }
3946
3947 return rslt;
3948}
3949
3954XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::bmi2_get_remap_axes(struct bmi2_remap *remapped_axis, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
3955{
3956 /* Variable to define error */
3957 XBYTESIG rslt;
3958
3959 /* Initialize the local structure for axis re-mapping */
3960 struct bmi2_axes_remap remap = { 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
3961
3962 /* Null-pointer check */
3963 rslt = null_ptr_check(dev);
3964 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (remapped_axis != NULL))
3965 {
3966 /* Get the re-mapped axes from the sensor */
3967 rslt = get_remap_axes(&remap, dev);
3968 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
3969 {
3970 /* Store the re-mapped x-axis value in device structure
3971 * and its user-value in the interface structure
3972 */
3973 switch (remap.x_axis)
3974 {
3975 case BMI2_MAP_X_AXIS:
3976
3977 /* If mapped to x-axis */
3978 dev->remap.x_axis = BMI2_MAP_X_AXIS;
3979 remapped_axis->x = BMI2_X;
3980 break;
3981 case BMI2_MAP_Y_AXIS:
3982
3983 /* If mapped to y-axis */
3984 dev->remap.x_axis = BMI2_MAP_Y_AXIS;
3985 remapped_axis->x = BMI2_Y;
3986 break;
3987 case BMI2_MAP_Z_AXIS:
3988
3989 /* If mapped to z-axis */
3990 dev->remap.x_axis = BMI2_MAP_Z_AXIS;
3991 remapped_axis->x = BMI2_Z;
3992 break;
3993 default:
3994 break;
3995 }
3996
3997 /* Store the re-mapped x-axis sign in device structure
3998 * and its user-value in the interface structure
3999 */
4000 if(remap.x_axis_sign)
4001 {
4002 /* If x-axis is mapped to -ve sign */
4003 dev->remap.x_axis_sign = BMI2_NEG_SIGN;
4004 remapped_axis->x |= BMI2_AXIS_SIGN;
4005 }
4006 else
4007 {
4008 dev->remap.x_axis_sign = BMI2_POS_SIGN;
4009 }
4010
4011 /* Store the re-mapped y-axis value in device structure
4012 * and its user-value in the interface structure
4013 */
4014 switch (remap.y_axis)
4015 {
4016 case BMI2_MAP_X_AXIS:
4017
4018 /* If mapped to x-axis */
4019 dev->remap.y_axis = BMI2_MAP_X_AXIS;
4020 remapped_axis->y = BMI2_X;
4021 break;
4022 case BMI2_MAP_Y_AXIS:
4023
4024 /* If mapped to y-axis */
4025 dev->remap.y_axis = BMI2_MAP_Y_AXIS;
4026 remapped_axis->y = BMI2_Y;
4027 break;
4028 case BMI2_MAP_Z_AXIS:
4029
4030 /* If mapped to z-axis */
4031 dev->remap.y_axis = BMI2_MAP_Z_AXIS;
4032 remapped_axis->y = BMI2_Z;
4033 break;
4034 default:
4035 break;
4036 }
4037
4038 /* Store the re-mapped y-axis sign in device structure
4039 * and its user-value in the interface structure
4040 */
4041 if(remap.y_axis_sign)
4042 {
4043 /* If y-axis is mapped to -ve sign */
4044 dev->remap.y_axis_sign = BMI2_NEG_SIGN;
4045 remapped_axis->y |= BMI2_AXIS_SIGN;
4046 }
4047 else
4048 {
4049 dev->remap.y_axis_sign = BMI2_POS_SIGN;
4050 }
4051
4052 /* Store the re-mapped z-axis value in device structure
