12041
12046XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::set_any_motion_config(const struct bmi2_any_motion_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12047{
12048 /* Variable to define error */
12049 XBYTESIG rslt;
12050
12051 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12052 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12053
12054 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12055 XBYTE idx = 0;
12056
12057 /* Variable to define count */
12058 XBYTE index = 0;
12059
12060 /* Variable to set flag */
12061 XBYTE feat_found;
12062
12063 /* Initialize feature configuration for any motion */
12064 struct bmi2_feature_config any_mot_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12065
12066 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
12067 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
12068
12069 /* Search for any-motion feature and extract its configuration details */
12070 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&any_mot_config, BMI2_ANY_MOTION, dev);
12071 if(feat_found)
12072 {
12073 /* Get the configuration from the page where any-motion feature resides */
12074 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(any_mot_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12075 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12076 {
12077 /* Define the offset in bytes for any-motion select */
12078 idx = any_mot_config.start_addr;
12079
12080 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
12081 idx = idx / 2;
12082
12083 /* Set duration */
12084 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_DUR, config->duration);
12085
12086 /* Set x-select */
12087 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_X_SEL, config->select_x);
12088
12089 /* Set y-select */
12090 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Y_SEL, config->select_y);
12091
12092 /* Set z-select */
12093 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Z_SEL, config->select_z);
12094
12095 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set threshold and output configuration */
12096 idx++;
12097
12098 /* Set threshold */
12099 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_THRES, config->threshold);
12100
12101 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to get the total length in words */
12102 idx++;
12103
12104 /* Get total length in bytes to copy from local pointer to the array */
12105 idx = (XBYTE)(idx * 2) - any_mot_config.start_addr;
12106
12107 /* Copy the bytes to be set back to the array */
12108 for (index = 0; index < idx; index++)
12109 {
12110 feat_config[any_mot_config.start_addr +
12111 index] = *((XBYTE *) data_p + any_mot_config.start_addr + index);
12112 }
12113
12114 /* Set the configuration back to the page */
12115 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FEATURES_REG_ADDR, feat_config, BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES, dev);
12116 }
12117 }
12118 else
12119 {
12120 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12121 }
12122
12123 return rslt;
12124}
12125
12130XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::set_no_motion_config(const struct bmi2_no_motion_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12131{
12132 /* Variable to define error */
12133 XBYTESIG rslt;
12134
12135 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12136 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12137
12138 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12139 XBYTE idx = 0;
12140
12141 /* Variable to define count */
12142 XBYTE index = 0;
12143
12144 /* Variable to set flag */
12145 XBYTE feat_found;
12146
12147 /* Initialize feature configuration for no-motion */
12148 struct bmi2_feature_config no_mot_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12149
12150 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
12151 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
12152
12153 /* Search for no-motion feature and extract its configuration details */
12154 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&no_mot_config, BMI2_NO_MOTION, dev);
12155 if(feat_found)
12156 {
12157 /* Get the configuration from the page where no-motion feature resides */
12158 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(no_mot_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12159 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12160 {
12161 /* Define the offset in bytes for no-motion select */
12162 idx = no_mot_config.start_addr;
12163
12164 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
12165 idx = idx / 2;
12166
12167 /* Set duration */
12168 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_DUR, config->duration);
12169
12170 /* Set x-select */
12171 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_X_SEL, config->select_x);
12172
12173 /* Set y-select */
12174 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Y_SEL, config->select_y);
12175
12176 /* Set z-select */
12177 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Z_SEL, config->select_z);
12178
12179 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set threshold and output configuration */
12180 idx++;
12181
12182 /* Set threshold */
12183 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_THRES, config->threshold);
12184
12185 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to get the total length in words */
12186 idx++;
12187
12188 /* Get total length in bytes to copy from local pointer to the array */
12189 idx = (XBYTE)(idx * 2) - no_mot_config.start_addr;
12190
12191 /* Copy the bytes to be set back to the array */
12192 for (index = 0; index < idx; index++)
12193 {
12194 feat_config[no_mot_config.start_addr +
12195 index] = *((XBYTE *) data_p + no_mot_config.start_addr + index);
12196 }
12197
12198 /* Set the configuration back to the page */
12199 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FEATURES_REG_ADDR, feat_config, BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES, dev);
12200 }
12201 }
12202 else
12203 {
12204 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12205 }
12206
12207 return rslt;
12208}
12209
12214XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::set_sig_motion_config(const struct bmi2_sig_motion_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12215{
12216 /* Variable to define error */
12217 XBYTESIG rslt;
12218
12219 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12220 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12221
12222 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12223 XBYTE idx = 0;
12224
12225 /* Variable to define index */
12226 XBYTE index = 0;
12227
12228 /* Variable to set flag */
12229 XBYTE feat_found;
12230
12231 /* Initialize feature configuration for sig-motion */
12232 struct bmi2_feature_config sig_mot_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12233
12234 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
12235 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
12236
12237 /* Search for sig-motion feature and extract its configuration details */
12238 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&sig_mot_config, BMI2_SIG_MOTION, dev);
12239 if(feat_found)
12240 {
12241 /* Get the configuration from the page where sig-motion feature resides */
12242 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(sig_mot_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12243 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12244 {
12245 /* Define the offset in bytes for sig-motion select */
12246 idx = sig_mot_config.start_addr;
12247
12248 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
12249 idx = idx / 2;
12250
12251 /* Set parameter 1 */
12252 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_1, config->block_size);
12253
12254 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set parameter 2 */
12255 idx++;
12256
12257 /* Set parameter 2 */
12258 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_2, config->param_2);
12259
12260 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set parameter 3 */
12261 idx++;
12262
12263 /* Set parameter 3 */
12264 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_3, config->param_3);
12265
12266 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set parameter 4 */
12267 idx++;
12268
12269 /* Set parameter 4 */
12270 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_4, config->param_4);
12271
12272 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set parameter 5 */
12273 idx++;
12274
12275 /* Set parameter 5 */
12276 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_5, config->param_5);
12277
12278 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set output- configuration */
12279 idx++;
12280
12281 /* Get total length in bytes to copy from local pointer to the array */
12282 idx = (XBYTE)(idx * 2) - sig_mot_config.start_addr;
12283
12284 /* Copy the bytes to be set back to the array */
12285 for (index = 0; index < idx; index++)
12286 {
12287 feat_config[sig_mot_config.start_addr +
12288 index] = *((XBYTE *) data_p + sig_mot_config.start_addr + index);
12289 }
12290
12291 /* Set the configuration back to the page */
12292 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FEATURES_REG_ADDR, feat_config, BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES, dev);
12293 }
12294 }
12295 else
12296 {
12297 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12298 }
12299
12300 return rslt;
12301}
12302
12306XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::set_step_count_params_config(const XWORD *step_count_params, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12307{
12308 /* Variable to define error */
12309 XBYTESIG rslt = BMI2_OK;
12310
12311 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12312 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12313
12314 /* Variable to define index */
12315 XBYTE index = 0;
12316
12317 /* Variable to set flag */
12318 XBYTE feat_found;
12319
12320 /* Initialize feature configuration for step counter parameters */
12321 struct bmi2_feature_config step_params_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12322
12323 /* Variable to index the page number */
12324 XBYTE page_idx;
12325
12326 /* Variable to define the start page */
12327 XBYTE start_page;
12328
12329 /* Variable to define start address of the parameters */
12330 XBYTE start_addr;
12331
12332 /* Variable to define number of bytes */
12333 XBYTE n_bytes = (BMI2_STEP_CNT_N_PARAMS * 2);
12334
12335 /* Variable to store number of pages */
12336 XBYTE n_pages = (n_bytes / 16);
12337
12338 /* Variable to define the end page */
12339 XBYTE end_page;
12340
12341 /* Variable to define the remaining bytes to be read */
12342 XBYTE remain_len;
12343
12344 /* Variable to define the maximum words(16 bytes or 8 words) to be read in a page */
12345 XBYTE max_len = 8;
12346
12347 /* Variable index bytes in a page */
12348 XBYTE page_byte_idx;
12349
12350 /* Variable to index the parameters */
12351 XBYTE param_idx = 0;
12352
12353 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
12354 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
12355
12356 /* Search for step counter parameter feature and extract its configuration details */
12357 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&step_params_config, BMI2_STEP_COUNTER_PARAMS, dev);
12358 if(feat_found)
12359 {
12360 /* Get the start page for the step counter parameters */
12361 start_page = step_params_config.page;
12362
12363 /* Get the end page for the step counter parameters */
12364 end_page = start_page + n_pages;
12365
12366 /* Get the start address for the step counter parameters */
12367 start_addr = step_params_config.start_addr;
12368
12369 /* Get the remaining length of bytes to be read */
12370 remain_len = (XBYTE)((n_bytes - (n_pages * 16)) + start_addr);
12371 for (page_idx = start_page; page_idx <= end_page; page_idx++)
12372 {
12373 /* Get the configuration from the respective page */
12374 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(page_idx, feat_config, dev);
12375 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12376 {
12377 /* Start from address 0x00 when switched to next page */
12378 if(page_idx > start_page)
12379 {
12380 start_addr = 0;
12381 }
12382
12383 /* Remaining number of words to be read in the page */
12384 if(page_idx == end_page)
12385 {
12386 max_len = (remain_len / 2);
12387 }
12388
12389 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
12390 page_byte_idx = start_addr / 2;
12391 for (; page_byte_idx < max_len;)
12392 {
12393 /* Set parameters 1 to 25 */
12394 *(data_p + page_byte_idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + page_byte_idx),
12395 BMI2_STEP_COUNT_PARAMS,
12396 step_count_params[param_idx]);
12397
12398 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set to the next parameter */
12399 page_byte_idx++;
12400
12401 /* Increment to next parameter */
12402 param_idx++;
12403 }
12404
12405 /* Get total length in bytes to copy from local pointer to the array */
12406 page_byte_idx = (XBYTE)(page_byte_idx * 2) - step_params_config.start_addr;
12407
12408 /* Copy the bytes to be set back to the array */
12409 for (index = 0; index < page_byte_idx; index++)
12410 {
12411 feat_config[step_params_config.start_addr +
12412 index] = *((XBYTE *) data_p + step_params_config.start_addr + index);
12413 }
12414
12415 /* Set the configuration back to the page */
12416 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FEATURES_REG_ADDR, feat_config, BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES, dev);
12417 }
12418 }
12419 }
12420 else
12421 {
12422 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12423 }
12424
12425 return rslt;
12426}
12427
12428/* @brief This internal API sets step counter configurations like water-mark
12429 * level, reset-counter and output-configuration step detector and activity.
12430 */
12431XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::set_step_config(const struct bmi2_step_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12432{
12433 /* Variable to define error */
12434 XBYTESIG rslt;
12435
12436 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12437 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12438
12439 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12440 XBYTE idx = 0;
12441
12442 /* Variable to define index */
12443 XBYTE index = 0;
12444
12445 /* Variable to set flag */
12446 XBYTE feat_found;
12447
12448 /* Initialize feature configuration for step counter 4 */
12449 struct bmi2_feature_config step_count_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12450
12451 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
12452 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
12453
12454 /* Search for step counter feature and extract its configuration details */
12455 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&step_count_config, BMI2_STEP_COUNTER, dev);
12456 if(feat_found)
12457 {
12458 /* Get the configuration from the page where step counter resides */
12459 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(step_count_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12460 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12461 {
12462 /* Define the offset in bytes */
12463 idx = step_count_config.start_addr;
12464
12465 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
12466 idx = idx / 2;
12467
12468 /* Set water-mark level */
12469 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BIT_POS0(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_STEP_COUNT_WM_LEVEL, config->watermark_level);
12470
12471 /* Set reset-counter */
12472 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_STEP_COUNT_RST_CNT, config->reset_counter);
12473
12474 /* Increment offset by 1 word to set output
12475 * configuration of step detector and step activity
12476 */
12477 idx++;
12478
12479 /* Set step buffer size */
12480 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_STEP_BUFFER_SIZE, config->step_buffer_size);
12481
12482 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to get the total length in words */
12483 idx++;
12484
12485 /* Get total length in bytes to copy from local pointer to the array */
12486 idx = (XBYTE)(idx * 2) - step_count_config.start_addr;
12487
12488 /* Copy the bytes to be set back to the array */
12489 for (index = 0; index < idx; index++)
12490 {
12491 feat_config[step_count_config.start_addr +
12492 index] = *((XBYTE *) data_p + step_count_config.start_addr + index);
12493 }
12494
12495 /* Set the configuration back to the page */
12496 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FEATURES_REG_ADDR, feat_config, BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES, dev);
12497 }
12498 }
12499 else
12500 {
12501 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12502 }
12503
12504 return rslt;
12505}
12506
12511XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::set_wrist_gest_config(const struct bmi2_wrist_gest_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12512{
12513 /* Variable to define error */
12514 XBYTESIG rslt;
12515
12516 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12517 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12518
12519 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12520 XBYTE idx = 0;
12521
12522 /* Variable to define index */
12523 XBYTE index = 0;
12524
12525 /* Variable to set flag */
12526 XBYTE feat_found;
12527
12528 /* Initialize feature configuration for wrist gesture */
12529 struct bmi2_feature_config wrist_gest_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12530
12531 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
12532 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
12533
12534 /* Search for wrist gesture feature and extract its configuration details */
12535 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&wrist_gest_config, BMI2_WRIST_GESTURE, dev);
12536 if(feat_found)
12537 {
12538 /* Get the configuration from the page where wrist gesture feature resides */
12539 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(wrist_gest_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12540 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12541 {
12542 /* Define the offset in bytes for gesture select */
12543 idx = wrist_gest_config.start_addr;
12544
12545 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
12546 idx = idx / 2;
12547
12548 /* Set wearable arm */
12549 *(data_p + idx) = BMI2_SET_BITS(*(data_p + idx), BMI2_WRIST_GEST_WEAR_ARM, config->wearable_arm);
12550
12551 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set minimum tilt angle (min_flick_peak) */
12552 idx++;
12553 *(data_p + idx) = config->min_flick_peak;
12554
12555 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set min_flick_samples */
12556 idx++;
12557 *(data_p + idx) = config->min_flick_samples;
12558
12559 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set max time within gesture moment has to be completed */
12560 idx++;
12561 *(data_p + idx) = config->max_duration;
12562
12563 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to get the total length in words */
12564 idx++;
12565
12566 /* Get total length in bytes to copy from local pointer to the array */
12567 idx = (XBYTE)(idx * 2) - wrist_gest_config.start_addr;
12568
12569 /* Copy the bytes to be set back to the array */
12570 for (index = 0; index < idx; index++)
12571 {
12572 feat_config[wrist_gest_config.start_addr +
12573 index] = *((XBYTE *) data_p + wrist_gest_config.start_addr + index);
12574 }
12575
12576 /* Set the configuration back to the page */
12577 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FEATURES_REG_ADDR, feat_config, BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES, dev);
12578 }
12579 }
12580 else
12581 {
12582 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12583 }
12584
12585 return rslt;
12586}
12587
12592XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::set_wrist_wear_wake_up_config(const struct bmi2_wrist_wear_wake_up_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12593{
12594 /* Variable to define error */
12595 XBYTESIG rslt;
12596
12597 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12598 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12599
12600 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12601 XBYTE idx = 0;
12602
12603 /* Variable to define index */
12604 XBYTE index = 0;
12605
12606 /* Variable to set flag */
12607 XBYTE feat_found;
12608
12609 /* Initialize feature configuration for wrist wear wake-up */
12610 struct bmi2_feature_config wrist_wake_up_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12611
12612 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
12613 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
12614
12615 /* Search for wrist wear wake-up feature and extract its configuration details */
12616 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&wrist_wake_up_config, BMI2_WRIST_WEAR_WAKE_UP, dev);
12617 if(feat_found)
12618 {
12619 /* Get the configuration from the page where wrist wear wake-up feature resides */
12620 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(wrist_wake_up_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12621 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12622 {
12623 /* Define the offset in bytes for wrist wear wake-up select */
12624 idx = wrist_wake_up_config.start_addr;
12625
12626 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
12627 idx = idx / 2;
12628
12629 *(data_p + idx) = config->min_angle_focus;
12630
12631 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set min_angle_nonfocus */
12632 idx++;
12633 *(data_p + idx) = config->min_angle_nonfocus;
12634
12635 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set max_tilt_lr */
12636 idx++;
12637 *(data_p + idx) = config->max_tilt_lr;
12638
12639 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set max_tilt_ll */
12640 idx++;
12641 *(data_p + idx) = config->max_tilt_ll;
12642
12643 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set max_tilt_pd */
12644 idx++;
12645 *(data_p + idx) = config->max_tilt_pd;
12646
12647 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to set max_tilt_pu */
12648 idx++;
12649 *(data_p + idx) = config->max_tilt_pu;
12650
12651 /* Increment offset by 1 more word to get the total length in words */
12652 idx++;
12653
12654 /* Get total length in bytes to copy from local pointer to the array */
12655 idx = (XBYTE)(idx * 2) - wrist_wake_up_config.start_addr;
12656
12657 /* Copy the bytes to be set back to the array */
12658 for (index = 0; index < idx; index++)
12659 {
12660 feat_config[wrist_wake_up_config.start_addr +
12661 index] = *((XBYTE *) data_p + wrist_wake_up_config.start_addr + index);
12662 }
12663
12664 /* Set the configuration back to the page */
12665 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_FEATURES_REG_ADDR, feat_config, BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES, dev);
12666 }
12667 }
12668 else
12669 {
12670 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12671 }
12672
12673 return rslt;
12674}
12675
12680XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_any_motion_config(struct bmi2_any_motion_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12681{
12682 /* Variable to define error */
12683 XBYTESIG rslt;
12684
12685 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12686 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12687
12688 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12689 XBYTE idx = 0;
12690
12691 /* Variable to define LSB */
12692 XWORD lsb;
12693
12694 /* Variable to define MSB */
12695 XWORD msb;
12696
12697 /* Variable to define a word */
12698 XWORD lsb_msb;
12699
12700 /* Variable to set flag */
12701 XBYTE feat_found;
12702
12703 /* Initialize feature configuration for any-motion */
12704 struct bmi2_feature_config any_mot_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12705
12706 /* Search for any-motion feature and extract its configuration details */
12707 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&any_mot_config, BMI2_ANY_MOTION, dev);
12708 if(feat_found)
12709 {
12710 /* Get the configuration from the page where any-motion feature resides */
12711 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(any_mot_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12712 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12713 {
12714 /* Define the offset for feature enable for any-motion */
12715 idx = any_mot_config.start_addr;
12716
12717 /* Get word to calculate duration, x, y and z select */
12718 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12719 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12720 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12721
12722 /* Get duration */
12723 config->duration = lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_DUR_MASK;
12724
12725 /* Get x-select */
12726 config->select_x = (lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_X_SEL_MASK) >> BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_X_SEL_POS;
12727
12728 /* Get y-select */
12729 config->select_y = (lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Y_SEL_MASK) >> BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Y_SEL_POS;
12730
12731 /* Get z-select */
12732 config->select_z = (lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Z_SEL_MASK) >> BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Z_SEL_POS;
12733
12734 /* Get word to calculate threshold, output configuration from the same word */
12735 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12736 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12737 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12738
12739 /* Get threshold */
12740 config->threshold = lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_THRES_MASK;
12741 }
12742 }
12743 else
12744 {
12745 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12746 }
12747
12748 return rslt;
12749}
12750
12755XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_no_motion_config(struct bmi2_no_motion_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12756{
12757 /* Variable to define error */
12758 XBYTESIG rslt;
12759
12760 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12761 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12762
12763 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12764 XBYTE idx = 0;
12765
12766 /* Variable to define LSB */
12767 XWORD lsb = 0;
12768
12769 /* Variable to define MSB */
12770 XWORD msb = 0;
12771
12772 /* Variable to define a word */
12773 XWORD lsb_msb = 0;
12774
12775 /* Variable to set flag */
12776 XBYTE feat_found;
12777
12778 /* Initialize feature configuration for no-motion */
12779 struct bmi2_feature_config no_mot_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12780
12781 /* Search for no-motion feature and extract its configuration details */
12782 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&no_mot_config, BMI2_NO_MOTION, dev);
12783 if(feat_found)
12784 {
12785 /* Get the configuration from the page where no-motion feature resides */
12786 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(no_mot_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12787 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12788 {
12789 /* Define the offset for feature enable for no-motion */
12790 idx = no_mot_config.start_addr;
12791
12792 /* Get word to calculate duration, x, y and z select */
12793 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12794 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12795 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12796
12797 /* Get duration */
12798 config->duration = lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_DUR_MASK;
12799
12800 /* Get x-select */
12801 config->select_x = (lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_X_SEL_MASK) >> BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_X_SEL_POS;
12802
12803 /* Get y-select */
12804 config->select_y = (lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Y_SEL_MASK) >> BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Y_SEL_POS;
12805
12806 /* Get z-select */
12807 config->select_z = (lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Z_SEL_MASK) >> BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_Z_SEL_POS;
12808
12809 /* Get word to calculate threshold, output configuration from the same word */
12810 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12811 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12812 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12813
12814 /* Get threshold */
12815 config->threshold = lsb_msb & BMI2_ANY_NO_MOT_THRES_MASK;
12816 }
12817 }
12818 else
12819 {
12820 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12821 }
12822
12823 return rslt;
12824}
12825
12830XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_sig_motion_config(struct bmi2_sig_motion_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12831{
12832 /* Variable to define error */
12833 XBYTESIG rslt;
12834
12835 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12836 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12837
12838 /* Variable to define the array offset */
12839 XBYTE idx = 0;
12840
12841 /* Variable to define LSB */
12842 XWORD lsb = 0;
12843
12844 /* Variable to define MSB */
12845 XWORD msb = 0;
12846
12847 /* Variable to define a word */
12848 XWORD lsb_msb = 0;
12849
12850 /* Variable to set flag */
12851 XBYTE feat_found;
12852
12853 /* Initialize feature configuration sig-motion */
12854 struct bmi2_feature_config sig_mot_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12855
12856 /* Search for sig-motion feature and extract its configuration details */
12857 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&sig_mot_config, BMI2_SIG_MOTION, dev);
12858 if(feat_found)
12859 {
12860 /* Get the configuration from the page where sig-motion feature resides */
12861 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(sig_mot_config.page, feat_config, dev);
12862 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12863 {
12864 /* Define the offset for feature enable for sig-motion */
12865 idx = sig_mot_config.start_addr;
12866
12867 /* Get word to calculate parameter 1 */
12868 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12869 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12870 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12871
12872 /* Get parameter 1 */
12873 config->block_size = lsb_msb & BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_1_MASK;
12874
12875 /* Get word to calculate parameter 2 */
12876 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12877 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12878 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12879
12880 /* Get parameter 2 */
12881 config->param_2 = lsb_msb & BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_2_MASK;
12882
12883 /* Get word to calculate parameter 3 */
12884 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12885 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12886 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12887
12888 /* Get parameter 3 */
12889 config->param_3 = lsb_msb & BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_3_MASK;
12890
12891 /* Get word to calculate parameter 4 */
12892 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12893 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12894 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12895
12896 /* Get parameter 4 */
12897 config->param_4 = lsb_msb & BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_4_MASK;
12898
12899 /* Get word to calculate parameter 5 */
12900 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
12901 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
12902 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
12903
12904 /* Get parameter 5 */
12905 config->param_5 = lsb_msb & BMI2_SIG_MOT_PARAM_5_MASK;
12906 }
12907 }
12908 else
12909 {
12910 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
12911 }
12912
12913 return rslt;
12914}
12915
12919XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_step_count_params_config(XWORD *step_count_params, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
12920{
12921 /* Variable to define error */
12922 XBYTESIG rslt = BMI2_OK;
12923
12924 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
12925 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
12926
12927 /* Variable to set flag */
12928 XBYTE feat_found;
12929
12930 /* Variable to define LSB */
12931 XWORD lsb = 0;
12932
12933 /* Variable to define MSB */
12934 XWORD msb = 0;
12935
12936 /* Variable to define a word */
12937 XWORD lsb_msb = 0;
12938
12939 /* Initialize feature configuration for step counter 1 */
12940 struct bmi2_feature_config step_params_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
12941
12942 /* Variable to index the page number */
12943 XBYTE page_idx;
12944
12945 /* Variable to define the start page */
12946 XBYTE start_page;
12947
12948 /* Variable to define start address of the parameters */
12949 XBYTE start_addr;
12950
12951 /* Variable to define number of bytes */
12952 XBYTE n_bytes = (BMI2_STEP_CNT_N_PARAMS * 2);
12953
12954 /* Variable to store number of pages */
12955 XBYTE n_pages = (n_bytes / 16);
12956
12957 /* Variable to define the end page */
12958 XBYTE end_page;
12959
12960 /* Variable to define the remaining bytes to be read */
12961 XBYTE remain_len;
12962
12963 /* Variable to define the maximum words to be read in a page */
12964 XBYTE max_len = BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES;
12965
12966 /* Variable index bytes in a page */
12967 XBYTE page_byte_idx;
12968
12969 /* Variable to index the parameters */
12970 XBYTE param_idx = 0;
12971
12972 /* Search for step counter parameter feature and extract its configuration details */
12973 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&step_params_config, BMI2_STEP_COUNTER_PARAMS, dev);
12974 if(feat_found)
12975 {
12976 /* Get the start page for the step counter parameters */
12977 start_page = step_params_config.page;
12978
12979 /* Get the end page for the step counter parameters */
12980 end_page = start_page + n_pages;
12981
12982 /* Get the start address for the step counter parameters */
12983 start_addr = step_params_config.start_addr;
12984
12985 /* Get the remaining length of bytes to be read */
12986 remain_len = (XBYTE)((n_bytes - (n_pages * 16)) + start_addr);
12987 for (page_idx = start_page; page_idx <= end_page; page_idx++)
12988 {
12989 /* Get the configuration from the respective page */
12990 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(page_idx, feat_config, dev);
12991 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
12992 {
12993 /* Start from address 0x00 when switched to next page */
12994 if(page_idx > start_page)
12995 {
12996 start_addr = 0;
12997 }
12998
12999 /* Remaining number of bytes to be read in the page */
13000 if(page_idx == end_page)
13001 {
13002 max_len = remain_len;
13003 }
13004
13005 /* Get the offset */
13006 page_byte_idx = start_addr;
13007 while (page_byte_idx < max_len)
13008 {
13009 /* Get word to calculate the parameter*/
13010 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[page_byte_idx++];
13011 if(page_byte_idx < max_len)
13012 {
13013 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[page_byte_idx++] << 8);
13014 }
13015
13016 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
13017
13018 /* Get parameters 1 to 25 */
13019 step_count_params[param_idx] = lsb_msb & BMI2_STEP_COUNT_PARAMS_MASK;
13020
13021 /* Increment to next parameter */
13022 param_idx++;
13023 }
13024 }
13025 }
13026 }
13027 else
13028 {
13029 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13030 }
13031
13032 return rslt;
13033}
13034
13038XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_step_config(struct bmi2_step_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13039{
13040 /* Variable to define error */
13041 XBYTESIG rslt;
13042
13043 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13044 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13045
13046 /* Variable to define the array offset */
13047 XBYTE idx = 0;
13048
13049 /* Variable to define LSB */
13050 XWORD lsb = 0;
13051
13052 /* Variable to define MSB */
13053 XWORD msb = 0;
13054
13055 /* Variable to define a word */
13056 XWORD lsb_msb = 0;
13057
13058 /* Variable to set flag */
13059 XBYTE feat_found;
13060
13061 /* Initialize feature configuration for step counter */
13062 struct bmi2_feature_config step_count_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
13063
13064 /* Search for step counter 4 feature and extract its configuration details */
13065 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&step_count_config, BMI2_STEP_COUNTER, dev);
13066 if(feat_found)
13067 {
13068 /* Get the configuration from the page where step counter 4 parameter resides */
13069 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(step_count_config.page, feat_config, dev);
13070 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13071 {
13072 /* Define the offset for feature enable for step counter/detector/activity */
13073 idx = step_count_config.start_addr;
13074
13075 /* Get word to calculate water-mark level and reset counter */
13076 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
13077 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
13078 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
13079
13080 /* Get water-mark level */
13081 config->watermark_level = lsb_msb & BMI2_STEP_COUNT_WM_LEVEL_MASK;
13082
13083 /* Get reset counter */
13084 config->reset_counter = (lsb_msb & BMI2_STEP_COUNT_RST_CNT_MASK) >> BMI2_STEP_COUNT_RST_CNT_POS;
13085
13086 /* Get word to calculate output configuration of step detector and activity */
13087 lsb = (XWORD) feat_config[idx++];
13088 msb = ((XWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
13089 lsb_msb = lsb | msb;
13090
13091 config->step_buffer_size = (lsb_msb & BMI2_STEP_BUFFER_SIZE_MASK) >> BMI2_STEP_BUFFER_SIZE_POS;
13092 }
13093 }
13094 else
13095 {
13096 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13097 }
13098
13099 return rslt;
13100}
13101
13106XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_wrist_gest_config(struct bmi2_wrist_gest_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13107{
13108 /* Variable to define error */
13109 XBYTESIG rslt;
13110
13111 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13112 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13113
13114 /* Variable to define the array offset */
13115 XBYTE idx = 0;
13116
13117 /* Variable to set flag */
13118 XBYTE feat_found;
13119
13120 /* Initialize feature configuration for wrist gesture */
13121 struct bmi2_feature_config wrist_gest_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
13122
13123 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
13124 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
13125
13126 /* Search for wrist gesture feature and extract its configuration details */
13127 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&wrist_gest_config, BMI2_WRIST_GESTURE, dev);
13128 if(feat_found)
13129 {
13130 /* Get the configuration from the page where wrist gesture feature resides */
13131 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(wrist_gest_config.page, feat_config, dev);
13132 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13133 {
13134 /* Define the offset in bytes for wrist gesture select */
13135 idx = wrist_gest_config.start_addr;
13136
13137 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
13138 idx = idx / 2;
13139
13140 /* Get wearable arm */
13141 config->wearable_arm = (*(data_p + idx) & BMI2_WRIST_GEST_WEAR_ARM_MASK) >> BMI2_WRIST_GEST_WEAR_ARM_POS;
13142
13143 /* Increment the offset by 1 word to get min_flick_peak */
13144 idx++;
13145 config->min_flick_peak = *(data_p + idx);
13146
13147 /* Increment the offset by 1 word to get min_flick_samples */
13148 idx++;
13149 config->min_flick_samples = *(data_p + idx);
13150
13151 /* Increment the offset by 1 word to get max_duration */
13152 idx++;
13153 config->max_duration = *(data_p + idx);
13154 }
13155 }
13156 else
13157 {
13158 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13159 }
13160
13161 return rslt;
13162}
13163
13168XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_wrist_wear_wake_up_config(struct bmi2_wrist_wear_wake_up_config *config, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13169{
13170 /* Variable to define error */
13171 XBYTESIG rslt;
13172
13173 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13174 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13175
13176 /* Variable to define the array offset */
13177 XBYTE idx = 0;
13178
13179 /* Variable to set flag */
13180 XBYTE feat_found;
13181
13182 /* Initialize feature configuration for wrist wear wake-up */
13183 struct bmi2_feature_config wrist_wake_up_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
13184
13185 /* Copy the feature configuration address to a local pointer */
13186 XWORD *data_p = (XWORD *) (void *)feat_config;
13187
13188 /* Search for wrist wear wake-up feature and extract its configuration details */
13189 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&wrist_wake_up_config, BMI2_WRIST_WEAR_WAKE_UP, dev);
13190 if(feat_found)
13191 {
13192 /* Get the configuration from the page where wrist wear wake-up feature resides */
13193 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(wrist_wake_up_config.page, feat_config, dev);
13194 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13195 {
13196 /* Define the offset in bytes for wrist wear wake-up select */
13197 idx = wrist_wake_up_config.start_addr;
13198
13199 /* Get offset in words since all the features are set in words length */
13200 idx = idx / 2;
13201
13202 config->min_angle_focus = *(data_p + idx);
13203
13204 /* Increment the offset value by 1 word to get min_angle_nonfocus */
13205 idx++;
13206 config->min_angle_nonfocus = *(data_p + idx);
13207
13208 /* Increment the offset value by 1 word to get max_tilt_lr */
13209 idx++;
13210 config->max_tilt_lr = *(data_p + idx);
13211
13212 /* Increment the offset value by 1 word to get max_tilt_ll */
13213 idx++;
13214 config->max_tilt_ll = *(data_p + idx);
13215
13216 /* Increment the offset value by 1 word to get max_tilt_pd */
13217 idx++;
13218 config->max_tilt_pd = *(data_p + idx);
13219
13220 /* Increment the offset value by 1 word to get max_tilt_pu */
13221 idx++;
13222 config->max_tilt_pu = *(data_p + idx);
13223
13224 }
13225 }
13226 else
13227 {
13228 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13229 }
13230
13231 return rslt;
13232}
13233
13237XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_wrist_gest_status(XBYTE *wrist_gest, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13238{
13239 /* Variable to define error */
13240 XBYTESIG rslt;
13241
13242 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13243 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13244
13245 /* Variables to define index */
13246 XBYTE idx = 0;
13247
13248 /* Variable to set flag */
13249 XBYTE feat_found;
13250
13251 /* Initialize feature output for wrist gesture */
13252 struct bmi2_feature_config wrist_gest_out_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
13253
13254 /* Search for wrist gesture feature and extract its configuration details */
13255 feat_found = extract_output_feat_config(&wrist_gest_out_config, BMI2_WRIST_GESTURE, dev);
13256 if(feat_found)
13257 {
13258 /* Get the feature output configuration for wrist gesture */
13259 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(wrist_gest_out_config.page, feat_config, dev);
13260 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13261 {
13262 /* Define the offset in bytes for wrist gesture output */
13263 idx = wrist_gest_out_config.start_addr;
13264
13265 /* Get the wrist gesture output */
13266 *wrist_gest = feat_config[idx];
13267 }
13268 }
13269 else
13270 {
13271 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13272 }
13273
13274 return rslt;
13275}
13276
13280XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_step_counter_output(XDWORD *step_count, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13281{
13282 /* Variable to define error */
13283 XBYTESIG rslt;
13284
13285 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13286 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13287
13288 /* Variables to define index */
13289 XBYTE idx = 0;
13290
13291 /* Variable to set flag */
13292 XBYTE feat_found;
13293
13294 /* Initialize feature output for step counter */
13295 struct bmi2_feature_config step_cnt_out_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
13296
13297 /* Search for step counter output feature and extract its configuration details */
13298 feat_found = extract_output_feat_config(&step_cnt_out_config, BMI2_STEP_COUNTER, dev);
13299 if(feat_found)
13300 {
13301 /* Get the feature output configuration for step-counter */
13302 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(step_cnt_out_config.page, feat_config, dev);
13303 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13304 {
13305 /* Define the offset in bytes for step counter output */
13306 idx = step_cnt_out_config.start_addr;
13307
13308 /* Get the step counter output in 4 bytes */
13309 *step_count = (XDWORD) feat_config[idx++];
13310 *step_count |= ((XDWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 8);
13311 *step_count |= ((XDWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 16);
13312 *step_count |= ((XDWORD) feat_config[idx++] << 24);
13313 }
13314 }
13315 else
13316 {
13317 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13318 }
13319
13320 return rslt;
13321}
13322
13326XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_nvm_error_status(struct bmi2_nvm_err_status *nvm_err_stat, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13327{
13328 /* Variable to define error */
13329 XBYTESIG rslt;
13330
13331 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13332 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13333
13334 /* Variables to define index */
13335 XBYTE idx = 0;
13336
13337 /* Variable to set flag */
13338 XBYTE feat_found;
13339
13340 /* Initialize feature output for NVM error status */
13341 struct bmi2_feature_config nvm_err_cfg = { 0, 0, 0 };
13342
13343 /* Search for NVM error status feature and extract its configuration details */
13344 feat_found = extract_output_feat_config(&nvm_err_cfg, BMI2_NVM_STATUS, dev);
13345 if(feat_found)
13346 {
13347 /* Get the feature output configuration for NVM error status */
13348 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(nvm_err_cfg.page, feat_config, dev);
13349 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13350 {
13351 /* Define the offset in bytes for NVM error status */
13352 idx = nvm_err_cfg.start_addr;
13353
13354 /* Increment index to get the error status */
13355 idx++;
13356
13357 /* Error when NVM load action fails */
13358 nvm_err_stat->load_error = BMI2_GET_BIT_POS0(feat_config[idx], BMI2_NVM_LOAD_ERR_STATUS);
13359
13360 /* Error when NVM program action fails */
13361 nvm_err_stat->prog_error = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_NVM_PROG_ERR_STATUS);
13362
13363 /* Error when NVM erase action fails */
13364 nvm_err_stat->erase_error = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_NVM_ERASE_ERR_STATUS);
13365
13366 /* Error when NVM program limit is exceeded */
13367 nvm_err_stat->exceed_error = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_NVM_END_EXCEED_STATUS);
13368
13369 /* Error when NVM privilege mode is not acquired */
13370 nvm_err_stat->privil_error = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_NVM_PRIV_ERR_STATUS);
13371 }
13372 }
13373 else
13374 {
13375 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13376 }
13377
13378 return rslt;
13379}
13380
13381
13394XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_user_gain_upd_status(XBYTE *status, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13395{
13396 /* Variable to define error */
13397 XBYTESIG rslt = BMI2_OK;
13398
13399 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13400 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13401
13402 /* Variable to define the array offset */
13403 XBYTE idx = 0;
13404
13405 /* Variable to set flag */
13406 XBYTE feat_found;
13407
13408 /* Variable to check APS status */
13409 XBYTE aps_stat = 0;
13410
13411 /* Initialize feature configuration for gyroscope user gain */
13412 struct bmi2_feature_config gyr_user_gain_cfg = { 0, 0, 0 };
13413
13414 /* Search for user gain feature and extract its configuration details */
13415 feat_found = bmi2_extract_input_feat_config(&gyr_user_gain_cfg, BMI2_GYRO_GAIN_UPDATE, dev);
13416 if(feat_found)
13417 {
13418 /* Disable advance power save */
13419 aps_stat = dev->aps_status;
13420 if(aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE)
13421 {
13422 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_DISABLE, dev);
13423 }
13424
13425 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13426 {
13427 /* Get the configuration from the page where user gain feature resides */
13428 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(gyr_user_gain_cfg.page, feat_config, dev);
13429 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13430 {
13431 /* Define the offset for enable/disable of user gain */
13432 idx = gyr_user_gain_cfg.start_addr + BMI2_GYR_USER_GAIN_FEAT_EN_OFFSET;
13433
13434 /* Set the feature enable status */
13435 *status = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_GYR_USER_GAIN_FEAT_EN);
13436 }
13437 }
13438 }
13439 else
13440 {
13441 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13442 }
13443
13444 /* Enable Advance power save if disabled while configuring and not when already disabled */
13445 if((rslt == BMI2_OK) && (aps_stat == BMI2_ENABLE))
13446 {
13447 rslt = bmi2_set_adv_power_save(BMI2_ENABLE, dev);
13448 }
13449
13450 return rslt;
13451}
13452
13453
13466XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_step_activity_output(XBYTE *step_act, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13467{
13468 /* Variable to define error */
13469 XBYTESIG rslt;
13470
13471 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13472 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13473
13474 /* Variables to define index */
13475 XBYTE idx = 0;
13476
13477 /* Variable to set flag */
13478 XBYTE feat_found;
13479
13480 /* Initialize feature output for step activity */
13481 struct bmi2_feature_config step_act_out_config = { 0, 0, 0 };
13482
13483 /* Search for step activity output feature and extract its configuration details */
13484 feat_found = extract_output_feat_config(&step_act_out_config, BMI2_STEP_ACTIVITY, dev);
13485 if(feat_found)
13486 {
13487 /* Get the feature output configuration for step-activity */
13488 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(step_act_out_config.page, feat_config, dev);
13489 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13490 {
13491 /* Define the offset in bytes for step activity output */
13492 idx = step_act_out_config.start_addr;
13493
13494 /* Get the step activity output */
13495 *step_act = feat_config[idx];
13496 }
13497 }
13498 else
13499 {
13500 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13501 }
13502
13503 return rslt;
13504}

13506
13519XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::get_vfrm_error_status(struct bmi2_vfrm_err_status *vfrm_err_stat, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13520{
13521 /* Variable to define error */
13522 XBYTESIG rslt;
13523
13524 /* Array to define the feature configuration */
13525 XBYTE feat_config[BMI2_FEAT_SIZE_IN_BYTES] = { 0 };
13526
13527 /* Variables to define index */
13528 XBYTE idx = 0;
13529
13530 /* Variable to set flag */
13531 XBYTE feat_found;
13532
13533 /* Initialize feature output for VFRM error status */
13534 struct bmi2_feature_config vfrm_err_cfg = { 0, 0, 0 };
13535
13536 /* Search for VFRM error status feature and extract its configuration details */
13537 feat_found = extract_output_feat_config(&vfrm_err_cfg, BMI2_VFRM_STATUS, dev);
13538 if(feat_found)
13539 {
13540 /* Get the feature output configuration for VFRM error status */
13541 rslt = bmi2_get_feat_config(vfrm_err_cfg.page, feat_config, dev);
13542 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13543 {
13544 /* Define the offset in bytes for VFRM error status */
13545 idx = vfrm_err_cfg.start_addr;
13546
13547 /* Increment index to get the error status */
13548 idx++;
13549
13550 /* Internal error while acquiring lock for FIFO */
13551 vfrm_err_stat->lock_error = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_VFRM_LOCK_ERR_STATUS);
13552
13553 /* Internal error while writing byte into FIFO */
13554 vfrm_err_stat->write_error = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_VFRM_WRITE_ERR_STATUS);
13555
13556 /* Internal error while writing into FIFO */
13557 vfrm_err_stat->fatal_error = BMI2_GET_BITS(feat_config[idx], BMI2_VFRM_FATAL_ERR_STATUS);
13558 }
13559 }
13560 else
13561 {
13562 rslt = BMI2_E_INVALID_SENSOR;
13563 }
13564
13565 return rslt;
13566}
13567
13568
13581XBYTESIG DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::enable_gyro_gain(XBYTE enable, struct bmi2_dev *dev)
13582{
13583 /* Variable to define error */
13584 XBYTESIG rslt;
13585
13586 /* Variable to define register data */
13587 XBYTE reg_data = 0;
13588
13589 rslt = bmi2_get_regs(BMI2_GYR_OFF_COMP_6_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
13590 if(rslt == BMI2_OK)
13591 {
13592 reg_data = BMI2_SET_BITS(reg_data, BMI2_GYR_GAIN_EN, enable);
13593 rslt = bmi2_set_regs(BMI2_GYR_OFF_COMP_6_ADDR, &reg_data, 1, dev);
13594 }
13595
13596 return rslt;
13597}

13631
13641void DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::Handler_Interrupt(void* param)
13642{
13643 DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270* imu = (DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270*)param;
13644 if(imu) imu->SetIsNecessaryUpdate(true);
13645}
13646
13647
13648
13657void DIOI2C6AXISTRACKINGBMI270::Clean()
13658{
13659 GPIOinterruptentryID = DIOGPIO_ID_NOTDEFINED;
13660
13661 isnecessaryupdate = false;
13662
13663 dev_addr = 0;
13664 memset(&bmi2_dev, 0, sizeof(struct bmi2_dev));
13665
13666 memset(sens_list, 0, 5);
13667
13668 sig_motion = 0;
13669 highGmotion = 0;
13670 lowGmotion = 0;
13671
13672 step_event = 0;
13673 tap_event = 0;
13674 any_motion = 0;
13675 no_motion = 0;
13676
13677 prev_status = -1;
13678}
